Name: Absorb
Description: Absorb deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. A Pokémon's HP may not go above its maximum.
Flavor Text: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Accelerock
Description: Accelerock deals damage and has high priority.
Flavor Text: The user smashes into the target at high speed. This move always goes first.
Meta: Changed to Agility attack

Name: Acid
Description: Acid deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: Opposing Pokémon are attacked with a spray of harsh acid. This may also lower their Sp. Def stats.
Meta: Changed to AOE attack

Name: Acid Armor
Description: Acid Armor raises the user's Defense by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user alters its cellular structure to liquefy itself, sharply raising its Defense stat.

Name: Acid Spray
Description: Acid Spray inflicts damage and lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user spits fluid that works to melt the target. This harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Acrobatics
Description: Acrobatics deals damage, however, if the user is not holding an item, its power doubles to 110. If the user is holding a Flying Gem, it is consumed before the Pokémon attacks, so it receives both boosts and increases Acrobatics' power to 145. Once the Gem is consumed Acrobatics' power for the rest of the battle will be 110.
Flavor Text: The user nimbly strikes the target. If the user is not holding an item, this attack inflicts massive damage.

Name: Acupressure
Description: Acupressure raises a random stat - 1) Attack, 2) Defense, 3) Speed, 4) Special Attack, 5) Special Defense, or 6) Evasion - by two stages. Roll 1d6 to determine the stat. Acupressure is unlike other status moves in that it can be targeted at itself or an adjacent teammate. It cannot be used on an ally if they are behind a Substitute, but the user can apply Acupressure to itself if behind a Substitute.
Flavor Text: The user applies pressure to stress points, sharply boosting one of its or its allies’ stats.
Meta: Removed chance to buff Accuracy so it would fit neatly on a d6

Name: Aerial Ace
Description: Aerial Ace deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: The user confounds the target with speed, then slashes. This attack never misses.
Meta: Changed to Agility attack

Name: Aeroblast
Description: Aeroblast deals damage and uses critical dice. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits. This move can only be used once per battle.
Flavor Text: A vortex of air is shot at the target to inflict damage. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: After You
Description: After You grants the target a bonus turn immediately after it is used. It can be targeted at opponents or allies. Priority moves such as Quick Attack cannot be triggered in between the two turns.
Flavor Text: The user helps the target and makes it use its move right after the user.
Meta: Reinterpreted due to turn order rules. Potentially overpowered?

Name: Agility
Description: Agility raises the user's Speed by two stages
Flavor Text: The user relaxes and lightens its body to move faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.

Name: Air Cutter
Description: Air Cutter deals damage and uses critical dice. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits.
Range: 1m x 20m line originating from the user
Flavor Text: The user launches razor-like wind to slash opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Air Slash
Description: Air Slash deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with a blade of air that slices even the sky. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Ally Switch
Description: Ally Switch swaps the positions of the user with a teammate. If that teammate was trapped by an opponent using Bind, Wrap, Block, etc., the user is now trapped in that same manner. The user cannot switch with allies in the first phase of Fly, Dig, Dive, Bounce, Shadow Force, or Sky Drop unless the user also knows the corresponding Move.
Flavor Text: The user teleports using a strange power and switches places with one of its allies.
Meta: Reinterpreted the switch based on movement rules

Name: Amnesia
Description: Amnesia raises the user's Special Defense by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its concerns. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Anchor Shot
Description: The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to move. Entanglement is treated as a normal Status Effect.
Flavor Text: The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to flee.

Name: Ancient Power
Description: Ancient Power deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of raising all the user's stats at once - Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed - by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with a prehistoric power. This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.

Name: Apple Acid
Description: The user attacks the target with an acidic liquid created from tart apples. Lowers target's Special Defense by one stage (100% chance)
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with an acidic liquid created from tart apples. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Aqua Jet
Description: Aqua Jet deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Flavor Text: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.

Name: Aqua Ring
Description: The user of Aqua Ring surrounds itself with a veil of water, which restores 10% of its maximum HP at the end of each turn (including this one) for 5 turns.
Flavor Text: The user envelops itself in a veil made of water. It regains some HP every turn.
Meta: does the healing take effect on first turn?

Name: Aqua Tail
Description: Aqua Tail deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a vicious wave in a raging storm.

Name: Arm Thrust
Description: Arm Thrust hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user lets loose a flurry of open-palmed arm thrusts that hit two to five times in a row.
Meta: Reinterpreted rules for this and all other multi-hit attacks so that they can target multiple foes and the number of hits is determined at the start. This setup still potentially requires the user to roll Accuracy on each hit which might be annoying.

Name: Aromatherapy
Description: Cures all status problems in your party, including stat decreases and Accuracy debuffs. Temporary type changes (such as Forest's Curse) and effects being actively maintained by another Pokémon (such as Bind or Telekinesis) are not changed. This Move may only be used once per battle.
Flavor Text: The user releases a soothing scent that heals all status conditions affecting the user’s party.
Meta: Original move wasn't clear on what statuses it cured, so added more details for that. Restricted to once per battle for balance.

Name: Aromatic Mist
Description: Aromatic Mist raises the Special Defense of a teammate by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user raises the Sp. Def stat of an ally Pokémon by using a mysterious aroma.

Name: Assist
Description: Assist uses a random move known by any of the user's ally Pokémon. The move is chosen by dice roll from the GM. Once the move is chosen it cannot be canceled unless it is physically impossible to perform in the current context (e.g. Attract being used by a genderless Pokémon).
Flavor Text: Assist uses a random move known by any of the user's party Pokémon.
Meta: Not sure of the specific mechanics for choosing a move

Name: Assurance
Description: Assurance deals damage, and if the target has already taken damage since their last turn, its power doubles to 120.
Flavor Text: If the target has already taken some damage in the same turn, this attack’s power is doubled.

Name: Astonish
Description: Astonish deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target while shouting in a startling fashion. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Astral Barrage
Description: The user attacks by sending a frightful amount of small ghosts at opposing Pokémon. This Move may only be used once per battle.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by sending a frightful amount of small ghosts at opposing Pokémon.

Name: Attack Order
Description: Attack Order deals damage and uses critical dice. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits.
Flavor Text: The user calls out its underlings to pummel the target. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Attract
Description: Attract causes Pokémon of the opposite gender to become infatuated. Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being immobilized by love each turn and unable to attack. Attract will fail on Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon and those with the ability Oblivious. This Move cannot be used by genderless Pokémon.
Flavor Text: If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.

Name: Aura Sphere
Description: Aura Sphere deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: The user lets loose a blast of aura power from deep within its body at the target. This attack never misses.

Name: Aura Wheel
Description: Aura Wheel is the signature move of Morpeko. It deals damage, but changes to Dark type when Morpeko is in Hangry Mode.
Flavor Text: Morpeko attacks and raises its Speed with the energy stored in its cheeks. This move’s type changes depending on the user’s form.
Meta: Changed to Agility attack

Name: Aurora Beam
Description: Aurora Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of lowering the target's Attack by one stage.
Range: 1m x 20m line originating from the user
Flavor Text: The target is hit with a rainbow-colored beam. This may also lower the target’s Attack stat.
Meta: Changed to a line AOE attack

Name: Aurora Veil
Description: Aurora Veil halves damage from Physical and Special attacks for five turns. The reduction applies to the final damage roll and is rounded down. This move can only be used in a hailstorm.
Range: All ally Pokémon within the hailstorm
Flavor Text: This move reduces damage from physical and special moves for five turns. This can be used only in a hailstorm.

Name: Autotomize
Description: Autotomize raises the user's Speed by two stages but lowers its Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user sheds part of its body to make itself lighter and sharply raise its Speed stat.
Meta: Removed weight change mechanic

Name: Avalanche
Description: A torrent of snow and ice falls down on the targeted area. This Move does not land until the beginning of the user's next turn. Those hit by the Avalanche are buried and must use their next move action to escape.
Flavor Text: A torrent of snow and ice builds up and then falls upon the targeted area.
Meta: Makes more narrative sense as an AOE attack. Since movement and turn order rules make it easily dodged, replaced the conditional power boost with a constant high power. Also added "buried" status effect afterwards.

Name: Baby-Doll Eyes
Description: Baby-Doll Eyes lowers the target's Attack by one stage, with increased priority.
Flavor Text: The user stares at the target with its baby-doll eyes, which lowers the target’s Attack stat. This move always goes first.

Name: Baneful Bunker
Description: Baneful Bunker prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, until the beginning of the user's next turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Baneful Bunker user on that turn, the attacker becomes poisoned. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. The effects do not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities. The accuracy of Baneful Bunker drops by one level each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or King's Shield.
Flavor Text: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also poisons any attacker that makes direct contact.

Name: Barrage
Description: Barrage hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: Round objects are hurled at the target to strike two to five times in a row.

Name: Barrier
Description: Barrier raises the user's Defense by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user throws up a sturdy wall that sharply raises its Defense stat.

Name: Baton Pass
Description: Baton Pass transfers all status effects from one target to another. Targets must either be two allies, or one ally and the user. Existing effects on the destination Pokémon remain in place, but transferred effects are removed from the source Pokémon. These effects are passed: - Increases and decreases in Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed. For example the effects from Nasty Plot, Swords Dance and Screech (if targeted at the source Pokémon). - The sure hit effect from Lock-On and Mind Reader. In other words, after using either move on the source Pokémon followed by Baton Pass, the next move from the destination Pokémon will always hit. - The confusion status ailment. - A Substitute, which keeps its remaining HP. - Movement-inhibiting effects from Mean Look and Spider Web. - Critical hit ratio increase from the move Focus Energy or a Lansat Berry. - The HP-restoring effects of Aqua Ring and Ingrain. - The effects of the moves Embargo, Gastro Acid, Magnet Rise, Perish Song and Power Trick.
Range: Any two ally Pokémon within view, including self
Flavor Text: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in waiting and passes along any stat changes.
Meta: Tricky tricky... It would be overpowered if you could pass to foes, so limited to allies only. Added the option to pass between unrelated allies. Is that unreasonable?

Name: Beak Blast
Description: The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target at the beginning of the user's next turn. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it's heating up its beak results in a burn.
Flavor Text: The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it’s heating up its beak results in a burn.

Name: Beat Up
Description: Beat Up gains +40 power for every ally Pokémon within 5m of the user that is not Fainted, has free movement, is not actively engaged in another attack, and is not affected by a status effect such as Sleep or Paralysis.
Flavor Text: The user gets all party Pokémon to attack the target. The more party Pokémon, the greater the number of attacks.
Meta: Original move had every nearby Pokémon do their own attack roll, but that seems like too many rolls with too many stats. So just changed the group buff to a flat +2 each. Nobody makes contact with the target so that makes things a bit easier

Name: Belch
Description: Belch deals damage, but only works if the user has previously consumed a Berry during the battle.
Flavor Text: The user lets out a damaging belch at the target.

Name: Belly Drum
Description: User loses 50% of its max HP, but Attack raises to maximum (+6 levels)
Flavor Text: The user maximizes its Attack stat in exchange for HP equal to half its max HP.

Name: Bestow
Description: Bestow gives the user's held item to the target. It will not work if the target is already holding an item or is behind a Substitute. Pokémon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot give away their held item. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
Flavor Text: The user passes its held item to the target when the target isn’t holding an item.

Name: Bide
Description: The user of Bide stores energy for 2 turns. At the end of the 2nd turn, the Pokémon unleashes energy, dealing twice the HP damage it received. The turn which Bide is used is turn 0. The next full turn is turn 1. The end of the next full turn (turn 2) is the actual attack. Bide deals fixed, typeless damage, so will hit Ghost-type Pokémon. It also ignores range, changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats, and can hit Pokémon in the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. Bide always hits the last Pokémon to attack the user (including teammates). If no damage was received, the attack fails and the user's turn ends. This move has priority, meaning it can be used proactively before the user's normal turn, in which case their regular "movement-only" turn is exhausted. Pokémon cannot use normal movement while charging energy. A Pokémon using Bide while suffering from a status effect will still apply those effects during all turns, but Paralysis and Confusion will not cancel the attack except on the final turn. The user may cancel Bide during turn 1, but no attack will happen.
Flavor Text: The user endures attacks for two turns, then strikes back to cause double the damage taken.
Meta: Had to clarify a lot of things related to status effects that I either guessed from the games or inferred from tabletop rules. There's probably still some edge cases. The rules say Paralyze and Confuse will cancel moves in progress but this is a somewhat of an exception

Name: Bind
Description: Bind inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: Things such as long bodies or tentacles are used to bind and squeeze the target for four to five turns.
Meta: Changed the rules to make binding moves not so cheap. The victim can attempt to break free, and can also still use Moves while bound.

Name: Bite
Description: Bite deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Blast Burn
Description: User loses their next turn due to recharge.
Flavor Text: The target is razed by a fiery explosion. The user can’t move on the next turn.

Name: Blaze Kick
Description: Blaze Kick deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of burning the target. It also uses critical dice. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits.
Flavor Text: The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit more easily. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Blizzard
Description: Blizzard deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of freezing each target. It will affect all Pokémon caught within its radius. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. During a hailstorm, Blizzard ignores accuracy.
Flavor Text: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing Pokémon. This may also leave the opposing Pokémon frozen.

Name: Block
Description: As long as the user and their target are adjacent to each other, if the target attempts to move they are automatically hit by the user with a Normal-type attack with base power 60, after which the movement is allowed. Moves which incorporate their own movement such as Dig, Teleport, Bounce, and Fly can bypass the block without harm.
Flavor Text: The user blocks the target’s way with arms spread wide to prevent escape.
Meta: Basically "you get an opportunity attack on your target if they move away"

Name: Blue Flare
Description: Blue Flare deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. This Move may only be used once per battle.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense, yet beautiful, blue flame. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Body Press
Description: The user's Defense stat dictates attack power, rather than their Attack stat.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by slamming its body into the target. The higher the user’s Defense, the more damage it can inflict on the target.

Name: Body Slam
Description: Body Slam deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the target has used Minimize, Body Slam ignores accuracy and deals double damage (after the attack role resolves).
Flavor Text: The user drops onto the target with its full body weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Bolt Beak
Description: If the target did not deal damage in their previous turn, the power of this move is doubled.
Flavor Text: The user stabs the target with its electrified beak. If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.
Meta: Changed "if this move goes first" behavior to "punish targets that haven't dealt damage". I get the feeling this move is overpowered in general, so it should be rarely seen...

Name: Bolt Strike
Description: Bolt Strike deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. This Move may only be used once per battle.
Flavor Text: The user surrounds itself with a great amount of electricity and charges its target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Bone Club
Description: Bone Club deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user clubs the target with a bone. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Bone Rush
Description: Bone Rush hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user strikes the target with a hard bone two to five times in a row.

Name: Bonemerang
Description: Bonemerang deals damage and will strike twice (with 50 base power each time). Each strike of Bonemerang is treated like a separate attack. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for more details.
Flavor Text: The user throws the bone it holds. The bone loops around to hit the target twice—coming and going.

Name: Boomburst
Description: Boomburst deals massive damage and targets all adjacent Pokémon in battle, including allies.
Flavor Text: The user attacks everything around it with the destructive power of a terrible, explosive sound.

Name: Bounce
Description: The user of Bounce will spring up on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. At the end of the second turn, Bounce deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of paralyzing the target. The user also moves adjacent to the target. While in the air, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Gust, Twister, Thunder, Sky Uppercut and Smack Down, with Gust and Twister dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Bounce executes in one turn.
Flavor Text: The user bounces up high, then drops on the target on the second turn. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
Meta: Mostly copied from Fly

Name: Branch Poke
Description: The user attacks the target by poking it with a sharply pointed branch.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target by poking it with a sharply pointed branch.

Name: Brave Bird
Description: Brave Bird deals damage, but the user receives one-third of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
Flavor Text: The user tucks in its wings and charges from a low altitude. This also damages the user quite a lot.
Meta: Doing 1/3 might be difficult without a calculator

Name: Breaking Swipe
Description: Hits multiple opponents and lowers their Attack by one level (100% chance).
Flavor Text: The user swings its tough tail wildly and attacks opposing Pokémon. This also lowers their Attack stats.
Meta: Reinterpreted targeting slightly

Name: Brick Break
Description: Brick Break deals damage, but removes the effects of Reflect and Light Screen before attacking.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with a swift chop. It can also break barriers, such as Light Screen and Reflect.

Name: Brine
Description: Power doubles if opponent's HP is less than 50%.
Flavor Text: If the target’s HP is half or less, this attack will hit with double the power.

Name: Brutal Swing
Description: The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity.
Flavor Text: The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity.

Name: Bubble
Description: Bubble deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of lowering the target's Speed by one stage.
Range: All Pokémon in a 90 degree cone extending forwards 15m
Flavor Text: A spray of countless bubbles is jetted at the opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their Speed stat.
Meta: I cast Cone of Bubbles

Name: Bubble Beam
Description: Bubble Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of lowering the target's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: A spray of bubbles is forcefully ejected at the target. This may also lower the target’s Speed stat.

Name: Bug Bite
Description: Bug Bite deals damage, and if the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect. For example, if the target is holding a Sitrus Berry the user will recover 25% of its HP. Bug Bite cannot steal a berry from a Substitute.
Flavor Text: The user bites the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.

Name: Bug Buzz
Description: Bug Buzz deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user generates a damaging sound wave by vibration. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Bulk Up
Description: Bulk Up raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body, raising both its Attack and Defense stats.

Name: Bulldoze
Description: Bulldoze deals damage and lowers each target's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user strikes everything around it by stomping down on the ground. This lowers the Speed stats of those hit.
Meta: Made into indiscriminate AOE

Name: Bullet Punch
Description: Bullet Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Flavor Text: The user strikes the target with tough punches as fast as bullets. This move always goes first.

Name: Bullet Seed
Description: Bullet Seed hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user forcefully shoots seeds at the target two to five times in a row.

Name: Burn Up
Description: To inflict massive damage, the user burns itself out. After using this move, the user will no longer be Fire type. This Move may only be used once per battle.
Flavor Text: To inflict massive damage, the user burns itself out. After using this move, the user will no longer be Fire type.
Meta: Restricted to once per battle

Name: Burning Jealousy
Description: Hits all opponents, and inflicts Burn on any that have had their stats boosted since the user's last turn.
Meta: reinterpreted as AOE effect and clarified turn order

Name: Calm Mind
Description: Calm Mind raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its spirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

Name: Camouflage
Description: Camouflage causes the user to change its type based on the current terrain (by GM's judgment). If the resulting type is different from the user's regular type, the user's Evasion is increased by one stage while they are camouflaged.
Flavor Text: The user’s type is changed depending on its environment, such as at water’s edge, in grass, or in a cave.
Meta: Type is up to interpretation a bit, but I really like this move so I want to make it viable. Added evasion increase while camouflaged

Name: Captivate
Description: Captivate lowers the Special Attack of each target by two stages, if they are of the opposite gender to the user. Captivate will fail if both Pokémon are the same gender, either Pokémon is genderless, or the target has the ability Oblivious.
Flavor Text: If any opposing Pokémon is the opposite gender of the user, it is charmed, which harshly lowers its Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Celebrate
Description: The Pokémon congratulates you on your special day. No battle effect.
Flavor Text: The Pokémon congratulates you on your special day!
Meta: This should have an out-of-combat effect

Name: Charge
Description: Charge raises the user's Special Defense by one stage, and if this Pokémon's next move is a damage-dealing Electric-type attack, it will deal double damage.
Flavor Text: The user boosts the power of the Electric move it uses on the next turn. This also raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Charge Beam
Description: Charge Beam deals damage and has a 70% chance (a d20 rolls 7 or higher) of raising the user's Special Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with an electric charge. The user may use any remaining electricity to raise its Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Charm
Description: Charm lowers the target's Attack by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user gazes at the target rather charmingly, making it less wary. This harshly lowers the target’s Attack stat.

Name: Chatter
Description: Chatter deals damage and causes the target to become confused. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with sound waves of deafening chatter. This confuses the target.

Name: Chip Away
Description: Chip Away deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case). Note this does not include the effects of screens like Reflect as they are different to regular stat boosts.
Flavor Text: Looking for an opening, the user strikes consistently. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage.

Name: Circle Throw
Description: The user grabs the target and spins them in a circle. At the beginning of the user's next turn, they throw the target to a space up to 20m away within view and inflict damage. The target may also suffer additional damage at the GM's discretion. Grabbed Pokémon lose their regular movement, but they can still use Moves during their turn. This Move cannot be used against opponents who are Rooted. Opponents who are raised using Levitate or similar effects do not suffer damage from the throw.
Flavor Text: The target is spun in a circle and thrown far away.
Meta: Changed the "swap out" mechanic with a forced movement one. I am basing this one kind of on Sky Drop with the grab mechanic. Since this move could potentially also throw the target into lava or whatever, I added the possibility of extra damage.

Name: Clamp
Description: Clamp inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The target is clamped and squeezed by the user’s very thick and sturdy shell for four to five turns.

Name: Clanging Scales
Description: Clanging Scales deals damage but lowers the user's Defense by one stage after attacking.
Flavor Text: The user rubs the scales on its entire body and makes a huge noise to attack opposing Pokémon. The user’s Defense stat goes down after the attack.

Name: Clangorous Soul
Description: Raises all user's stats by one stage, but loses 1/3 of their current HP.
Flavor Text: The user raises all its stats by using some of its HP.
Meta: calculating 1/3 of current HP might be tough but it has to be implemented somehow

Name: Clear Smog
Description: Removes all of the target's stat changes, both positive and negative. Stat changes are ones which affect Attack, Defense, Speed, Accuracy, Evasion, etc. Status effects such as Poison are unchanged.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target by throwing a clump of special mud. All stat changes are returned to normal.
Meta: Clarified what stat changes are resolved.

Name: Close Combat
Description: Close Combat deals damage but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each after attacking.
Flavor Text: The user fights the target up close without guarding itself. This also lowers the user’s Defense and Sp. Def stats.
Meta: I considered making this once-per-battle since it has PP of 5, but I think the debuff balances it out enough.

Name: Coaching
Description: The user properly coaches its ally Pokémon, boosting their Attack and Defense stats by one stage.

Name: Coil
Description: Coil raises the user's Attack, Defense and Accuracy by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user coils up and concentrates. This raises its Attack and Defense stats as well as its accuracy.

Name: Comet Punch
Description: Comet Punch hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The target is hit with a flurry of punches that strike two to five times in a row.

Name: Confide
Description: Confide lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user tells the target a secret, and the target loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Confuse Ray
Description: Confuse Ray causes the target to become confused. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The target is exposed to a sinister ray that triggers confusion.

Name: Confusion
Description: Confusion deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force. This may also confuse the target.

Name: Constrict
Description: Constrict deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of lowering the target's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with long, creeping tentacles, vines, or the like. This may also lower the target’s Speed stat.

Name: Conversion
Description: Conversion changes the user's type to the same type as one of the moves in the Pokémon's move list.
Flavor Text: The user changes its type to become the same type as the move at the top of the list of moves it knows.

Name: Conversion 2
Description: Conversion 2 changes the user's type to one that is resistant (or immune) to the last move used by the target, randomly. For example, if the target last used a Fighting type move, Conversion 2 would change the user's type to one of Poison, Flying, Psychic, Bug, Ghost or Fairy at random.
Flavor Text: The user changes its type to make itself resistant to the type of the attack the target used last.
Meta: Need to clarify how the random selection is done

Name: Copycat
Description: The user mimics the Move used immediately before it. The Move fails if no other Move has been used yet.
Flavor Text: The user mimics the move used immediately before it. The move fails if no other move has been used yet.

Name: Core Enforcer
Description: If any Pokémon struck by this attack have previously attacked the user, this move eliminates the effect of the target's Ability for the duration of the battle.
Flavor Text: If the Pokémon the user has inflicted damage on have already used their moves, this move eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability.
Meta: The original description of this one is vague, so I reinterpreted it as a "revenge" mechanic

Name: Corrosive Gas
Description: The user surrounds everything around its target with highly acidic gas and melts away items they hold.
Flavor Text: The user surrounds everything around its target with highly acidic gas and melts away items they hold.

Name: Cosmic Power
Description: Cosmic Power raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to raise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

Name: Cotton Guard
Description: Cotton Guard raises the user's Defense by three stages.
Flavor Text: The user protects itself by wrapping its body in soft cotton, which drastically raises the user’s Defense stat.

Name: Cotton Spore
Description: Cotton Spore lowers the target's Speed by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user releases cotton-like spores that cling to opposing Pokémon, which harshly lowers their Speed stats.

Name: Counter
Description: If the user is hit by a Physical Attack before the start of their next turn, the user strikes back with a Fighting-type attack with 2x of that move's base power.
Flavor Text: A retaliation move that counters any physical attack, inflicting double the damage taken.
Meta: Clarified the nature of the counterattack

Name: Court Change
Description: Swaps the effects on either side of the field.
Flavor Text: With its mysterious power, the user swaps the effects on either side of the field.
Meta: No idea how to interpret this one

Name: Covet
Description: Covet deals damage and steals the target's held item, if the user is not holding an item. If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen. Pokémon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
Flavor Text: The user endearingly approaches the target, then steals the target’s held item.
Meta: This is just the same thing as Thief

Name: Crabhammer
Description: Crabhammer deals damage and uses critical dice.
Flavor Text: The target is hammered with a large pincer. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Crafty Shield
Description: Crafty Shield protects the user and their allies from any Status category move targeted at them, until the beginning of the user's next turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves. It does not protect against the moves Perish Song, Spikes, Stealth Rock, Toxic Spikes, or Sticky Web; and it does not prevent moves that target the attacker itself (such as Rest).
Flavor Text: The user protects itself and its allies from status moves with a mysterious power. This does not stop moves that do damage.

Name: Cross Chop
Description: Cross Chop deals damage and uses critical dice.
Flavor Text: The user delivers a double chop with its forearms crossed. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Cross Poison
Description: Cross Poison deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of poisoning the target. It also uses critical dice. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: A slashing attack with a poisonous blade that may also poison the target. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Crunch
Description: Crunch deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Crush Claw
Description: Crush Claw deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user slashes the target with hard and sharp claws. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Crush Grip
Description: Crush Grip's base power is equal to the current HP of the target Pokémon, to a maximum of 110.
Flavor Text: The target is crushed with great force. The more HP the target has left, the greater this move’s power.
Meta: It's simplest to just use the straight HP value for power but I haven't tested out how balanced that is.

Name: Curse
Description: Curse is a unique move that works differently for Ghost-type Pokémon than other Pokémon. Ghost-type Pokémon use 50% of their current HP to lower the target's current HP by 50%. For all other Pokémon, Curse raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each and lowers Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: A move that works differently for the Ghost type than for all other types.
Meta: Changed to flat percentage, but also is this imbalanced against bosses?

Name: Cut
Description: Cut deals damage with no additional effect in battle.
Flavor Text: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.

Name: Dark Pulse
Description: Dark Pulse deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark thoughts. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Dark Void
Description: Dark Void puts the target(s) to sleep. It can only be used by Darkrai. It targets all adjacent opponents. Each target is counted as a separate attack so it may succeed for all, any or none of the targets. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
Flavor Text: Opposing Pokémon are dragged into a world of total darkness that makes them sleep.

Name: Darkest Lariat
Description: Darkest Lariat deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case).
Flavor Text: The user swings both arms and hits the target. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage.

Name: Dazzling Gleam
Description: Dazzling Gleam deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents.
Flavor Text: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a powerful flash.

Name: Decorate
Description: Sharply raises target's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages. (100% chance). This Move cannot be used multiple times on the same target.
Flavor Text: The user sharply raises the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats by decorating the target.
Meta: I'm assuming this move can't be used on self or it would be pretty OP. Even now it's still kind of broken

Name: Defend Order
Description: Defend Order raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user calls out its underlings to shield its body, raising its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

Name: Defense Curl
Description: Defense Curl raises the user's Defense by one stage. After Defense Curl has been used at least once and while the user stays in battle, the power of Rollout and Ice Ball is double their regular base power.
Flavor Text: The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise its Defense stat.

Name: Defog
Description: Defog lowers the target's Evasion by one stage and removes hazards and barriers around the user. The moves affected are: Light Screen, Reflect, Mist, Safeguard, Spikes, Stealth Rock, Sticky Web and Toxic Spikes. Defog also clears foggy weather in battle (which causes Accuracy loss when present).
Flavor Text: A strong wind blows away the target’s barriers such as Reflect or Light Screen. This also lowers the target’s evasiveness.

Name: Destiny Bond
Description: If the user faints before their next turn, the Pokémon who landed the knockout hit also faints. This Move's accuracy decreases by one stage after each successive use. If the user fainted because of indirect damage such as from Poison or Burn, no one else faints.
Flavor Text: After using this move, if the user faints, the Pokémon that landed the knockout hit also faints. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
Meta: Clarified who faints and when

Name: Detect
Description: Detect causes any attacks targeted at the user to have 0% accuracy, until the beginning of their next turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The move is similar to Protect, however, Protect takes the hit and negates damage, while Detect negates the attack's accuracy. The accuracy of Detect decreases by one stage each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker. Moves with infinite accuracy or under effects such as Mind Reader can still bypass Detect.
Flavor Text: This move enables the user to evade all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
Meta: There are some subtle differences between Protect and Detect that I want to keep here because they seem interesting.

Name: Diamond Storm
Description: Diamond Storm deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of raising the user's Defense by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user whips up a storm of diamonds to damage opposing Pokémon. This may also sharply raise the user’s Defense stat.
Meta: Changed to AOE attack

Name: Dig
Description: The user of Dig will burrow its way underground on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On their next turn, the attack lands, the user moves adjacent to their target, and the turn concludes. While underground, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Earthquake, Magnitude or Fissure, with Earthquake and Magnitude dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. The user also avoids end-of-turn damage from Sandstorm and Hail when underground. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Dig executes in one turn. Dig can be used non-offensively to move to otherwise inaccessible areas during battle, in which case there is no attack roll.
Flavor Text: The user burrows into the ground, then attacks on the next turn.
Meta: Clarified how movement happens during Dig, and specifically I want to avoid being able to do hit-and-runs where you escape afterwards. Added out-of-battle use guidance.

Name: Disable
Description: Disable causes the previous move the target used to be disabled and unable to be used for 1d4 of their turns. If the move is currently in progress (such as Rollout or Sky Drop), it is not canceled.
Flavor Text: For four turns, this move prevents the target from using the move it last used.
Meta: Changed disable length to 1d4 turns.

Name: Disarming Voice
Description: Disarming Voice deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: Letting out a charming cry, the user does emotional damage to opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.

Name: Discharge
Description: Discharge deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of paralyzing the target(s). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The user strikes everything around it by letting loose a flare of electricity. This may also cause paralysis.
Meta: Changed to indiscriminate AOE

Name: Dive
Description: Only usable in water. The user of Dive will hide underwater on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Dive deals damage. While underwater, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Surf, Whirlpool or Low Kick, with Surf and Whirlpool dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. The user also avoids end-of-turn damage from Sandstorm and Hail when underwater. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Dive executes in one turn.
Flavor Text: Diving on the first turn, the user floats up and attacks on the next turn.
Meta: Treating this one like Fly basically

Name: Dizzy Punch
Description: Dizzy Punch deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The target is hit with rhythmically launched punches. This may also leave the target confused.

Name: Doom Desire
Description: At the beginning of the user's 2nd turn after this move is selected, Doom Desire will deal damage. This Move may not be active more than once per user at a time.
Flavor Text: Two turns after this move is used, a concentrated bundle of light blasts the target.
Meta: Nerfed it a little by making it non-repeatable

Name: Double Hit
Description: Double Hit deals damage and will strike twice (with 35 base power each time). See the rules for "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user slams the target with a long tail, vines, or a tentacle. The target is hit twice in a row.

Name: Double Iron Bash
Description: Double Iron Bash deals damage, will strike twice (with 60 base power each time), and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target(s) to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. See the rules for "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user rotates, centering the hex nut in its chest, and then strikes with its arms twice in a row. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Double Kick
Description: Double Kick deals damage and will strike twice (with 30 base power each time). See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The target is quickly kicked twice in succession using both feet.

Name: Double Slap
Description: Double Slap hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The target is slapped repeatedly, back and forth, two to five times in a row.

Name: Double Team
Description: Double Team raises the user's Evasiveness by one stage, thus making the user more difficult to hit.
Flavor Text: By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.

Name: Double-Edge
Description: Double-Edge deals damage, but the user receives 1/3 of the damage it inflicted (rounded down) in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
Flavor Text: A reckless, life-risking tackle in which the user rushes the target. This also damages the user quite a lot.

Name: Draco Meteor
Description: Draco Meteor deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.
Flavor Text: Comets are summoned down from the sky onto the target. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Dragon Ascent
Description: Dragon Ascent deals damage but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each after attacking. It is the signature move of Rayquaza, and once learned allows Rayquaza to Mega-Evolve.
Flavor Text: After soaring upward, the user attacks its target by dropping out of the sky at high speeds. But it lowers its own Defense and Sp. Def stats in the process.

Name: Dragon Breath
Description: Dragon Breath deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The user exhales a mighty gust that inflicts damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Dragon Claw
Description: Dragon Claw deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.

Name: Dragon Dance
Description: Dragon Dance raises the user's Attack and Speed by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful dance that raises its Attack and Speed stats.

Name: Dragon Darts
Description: Dragon Darts deals damage and hits twice. See the rules for "Multi-Hit Moves" for more details
Flavor Text: The user attacks twice using Dreepy. If there are two targets, this move hits each target once.

Name: Dragon Energy
Description: The base power of this Move is equal to the user's current HP
Flavor Text: Converting its life-force into power, the user attacks opposing Pokémon. The lower the user’s HP, the lower the move’s power.
Meta: Hoping that using the HP stat straight across won't be too overpowered.

Name: Dragon Hammer
Description: The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage.
Flavor Text: The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage.

Name: Dragon Pulse
Description: Dragon Pulse deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated by the user’s gaping mouth.

Name: Dragon Rage
Description: Dragon Rage always deals 40 HP damage to the target, regardless of typing. It has no additional effect.
Flavor Text: This attack hits the target with a shock wave of pure rage. This attack always inflicts 40 HP damage.

Name: Dragon Rush
Description: Dragon Rush deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. If the target has used Minimize, Dragon Rush ignores accuracy and deals double damage.
Flavor Text: The user tackles the target while exhibiting overwhelming menace. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Dragon Tail
Description: On a successful hit, the user knocks their target back by up to 20m
Flavor Text: The target is knocked away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.
Meta: Reinterpreted "knocked away" to mean movement instead of switching

Name: Drain Punch
Description: Drain Punch deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Flavor Text: An energy-draining punch. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Draining Kiss
Description: Draining Kiss deals damage and the user will recover 75% of the HP drained.
Flavor Text: The user steals the target’s HP with a kiss. The user’s HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.

Name: Dream Eater
Description: Dream Eater deals damage only on sleeping foes and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Flavor Text: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Drill Peck
Description: A corkscrewing attack that strikes the target with a sharp beak acting as a drill.
Flavor Text: A corkscrewing attack that strikes the target with a sharp beak acting as a drill.
Meta: Changed range to equal movement distance

Name: Drill Run
Description: Drill Run deals damage and uses critical dice.
Flavor Text: The user crashes into its target while rotating its body like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Drum Beating
Description: Lowers opponent's Speed. (100% chance)
Flavor Text: The user plays its drum, controlling the drum’s roots to attack the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat.

Name: Dual Chop
Description: Dual Chop deals damage and will strike twice (with 40 base power each time). See the rules for "Multi-Hit Attacks" for details.
Flavor Text: The user attacks its target by hitting it with brutal strikes. The target is hit twice in a row.

Name: Dual Wingbeat
Description: The user slams the target with its wings. The Move will strike twice in a row. See the rules for "Multi-Hit Attacks" for details.

Name: Dynamic Punch
Description: Dynamic Punch deals damage and confuses the target, if it hits. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user punches the target with full, concentrated power. This confuses the target if it hits.
Meta: May be a little OP

Name: Earth Power
Description: Earth Power deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user makes the ground under the target erupt with power. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Earthquake
Description: Earthquake deals damage, and will hit with double power if the opponent is underground due to the move Dig.
Flavor Text: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.

Name: Echoed Voice
Description: Echoed Voice deals damage starting at base power 40, and increases by 40 on each turn it is used by any Pokémon on the field afterwards, up to a maximum base power of 200. The power resets if a full turn passes without the Move being used. Power does not reset if it misses, as long as the move is attempted each turn. The power does not increase immediately after each use (if multiple Pokémon use the Move), only at the beginning of the turn of the Pokémon who first used the Move.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with an echoing voice. If this move is used every turn, its power is increased.
Meta: Turn order is a bit wonky but I think I translated the intention across

Name: Eerie Impulse
Description: Eerie Impulse lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user’s body generates an eerie impulse. Exposing the target to it harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Eerie Spell
Description: Eerie Spell deals damage and prevents the target from using their last-used move on their next turn.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with its tremendous psychic power. This also removes 3 PP from the target’s last move.
Meta: Changed PP loss to a Disable effect instead

Name: Egg Bomb
Description: Egg Bomb deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: A large egg is hurled at the target with maximum force to inflict damage.

Name: Electric Terrain
Description: Electric Terrain creates a low-lying electric field lasting 5 turns, which increases the power of Electric type moves by 50% while in effect. It also prevents grounded Pokémon from falling asleep. The . Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Electric Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.
Flavor Text: The user electrifies the ground for five turns, powering up Electric-type moves. Pokémon on the ground no longer fall asleep.

Name: Electrify
Description: Electrify causes the target's next Move to become Electric type. This move has priority over most other moves.
Flavor Text: If the target is electrified before it uses a move during that turn, the target’s move becomes Electric type.
Meta: Changed to make this a high-priority interrupt move

Name: Electro Ball
Description: Electro Ball is considered a Special attack and is defended against using Special Defense, but its power is calculated based on the attacker's Speed stat.
Flavor Text: The user hurls an electric orb at the target. The faster the user is than the target, the greater the move’s power.
Meta: replaced complex math with a Speed vs. Sp. Def baseline attack

Name: Electroweb
Description: Electroweb deals damage and lowers each target's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user attacks and captures opposing Pokémon using an electric net. This lowers their Speed stats.
Meta: changed to AOE

Name: Embargo
Description: Embargo prevents the target(s) using any items for five turns.
Flavor Text: This move prevents the target from using its held item for five turns.

Name: Ember
Description: Ember deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with small flames. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Encore
Description: Encore forces the target to use the previously selected move for 3 turns. Encore does not work against Encore itself, Mimic, Mirror Move, Sketch, Struggle or Transform.
Flavor Text: The user compels the target to keep using the move it encored for three turns.

Name: Endeavor
Description: Endeavor reduces the target's HP to equal the user's. (It fails if the user's HP is higher than the target's.)
Flavor Text: This attack move cuts down the target’s HP to equal the user’s HP.
Meta: No idea how I can balance this one because of the Focus Sash Rattata strat still being able to cheese boss fights.

Name: Endure
Description: Endure allows the user to survive all attacks until the beginning of turn with at least 1 HP (even if it already has 1 HP remaining). It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The accuracy of Endure decreases by one stage each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker.
Flavor Text: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

Name: Energy Ball
Description: Energy Ball deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Entrainment
Description: Entrainment makes the target's ability the same as the user's. It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant, Multitype or Zen Mode.
Flavor Text: The user dances with an odd rhythm that compels the target to mimic it, making the target’s Ability the same as the user’s.

Name: Eruption
Description: Eruption's base power is equal to the user's current HP, to a maximum of 150.
Flavor Text: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with explosive fury. The lower the user’s HP, the lower the move’s power.
Meta: Copying HP stat straight across to power. Also changed to indiscriminate AOE

Name: Eternabeam
Description: User can't move on the next turn.
Range: 1m x 20m line originating from the user
Flavor Text: This is Eternatus’s most powerful attack in its original form. The user can’t move on the next turn.

Name: Expanding Force
Description: The user attacks a target with its psychic power. This move’s power increases to 120 and damages all opposing Pokémon on Psychic Terrain.
Range: Single or Multiple Pokémon within view

Name: Explosion
Description: Explosion deals high damage, but causes the user to faint.
Flavor Text: The user attacks everything around it by causing a tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using this move.

Name: Extrasensory
Description: Extrasensory deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with an odd, unseeable power. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Extreme Speed
Description: Extreme Speed deals damage and attacks before the majority of other moves (priority of +2).
Flavor Text: The user charges the target at blinding speed. This move always goes first.

Name: Facade
Description: Facade deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the user is burned, poisoned or paralyzed. In the case of a burn, the usual attack-halving still occurs.
Flavor Text: This attack move doubles its power if the user is poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.

Name: Fairy Lock
Description: Fairy Lock prevents all Pokémon on the field from moving until the beginning of the user's next turn.
Flavor Text: By locking down the battlefield, the user keeps all Pokémon from fleeing during the next turn.

Name: Fairy Wind
Description: Fairy Wind deals damage with no added effects.
Flavor Text: The user stirs up a fairy wind and strikes the target with it.

Name: Fake Out
Description: Fake Out attacks with a priority of +3 and causes the target to flinch if it hits. It is only successful on the first turn the Pokémon is in battle. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: This attack hits first and makes the target flinch. It only works the first turn each time the user enters battle.

Name: Fake Tears
Description: Fake Tears lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user feigns crying to fluster the target, harshly lowering its Sp. Def stat.

Name: False Surrender
Description: Ignores Accuracy and Evasiveness.
Flavor Text: The user pretends to bow its head, but then it stabs the target with its disheveled hair. This attack never misses.

Name: False Swipe
Description: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.
Flavor Text: A restrained attack that prevents the target from fainting. The target is left with at least 1 HP.

Name: Feather Dance
Description: Feather Dance lowers the target's Attack by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user covers the target’s body with a mass of down that harshly lowers its Attack stat.

Name: Feint
Description: Feint only hits if the target used Protect or Detect in the same turn. It also cancels Protect/Detect for the remainder of the turn, so subsequent moves in the same turn (in double/triple battles) can still hit.
Flavor Text: This attack hits a target using a move such as Protect or Detect. This also lifts the effects of those moves.

Name: Feint Attack
Description: Feint Attack deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: The user approaches the target disarmingly, then throws a sucker punch. This attack never misses.

Name: Fell Stinger
Description: Fell Stinger deals damage, and if the target is knocked out by this move, the user's Attack is raised by three stages.
Flavor Text: When the user knocks out a target with this move, the user’s Attack stat rises drastically.

Name: Fiery Dance
Description: Fiery Dance deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of raising the user's Special Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: Cloaked in flames, the user attacks the target by dancing and flapping its wings. This may also raise the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Fiery Wrath
Description: 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of causing the target(s) to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user transforms its wrath into a fire-like aura to attack. This may also make opposing Pokémon flinch.

Name: Final Gambit
Description: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP. User faints.
Flavor Text: The user risks everything to attack its target. The user faints but does damage equal to its HP.

Name: Fire Blast
Description: Fire Blast deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Fire Fang
Description: Fire Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of burning the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user bites with flame-cloaked fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with a burn.

Name: Fire Lash
Description: The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target's Defense stat. (100% chance)
Flavor Text: The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Fire Pledge
Description: Fire Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Grass Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear. The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting. If Fire Pledge is used with Grass Pledge, the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns. If Fire Pledge is used with Water Pledge, the move animation shows Water Pledge and a rainbow appears in the sky on your team's side that doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring for 4 turns.
Flavor Text: A column of fire hits the target. When used with its grass equivalent, its power increases and a vast sea of fire appears.

Name: Fire Punch
Description: Fire Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Fire Spin
Description: Fire Spin inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The target becomes trapped within a fierce vortex of fire that rages for four to five turns.

Name: First Impression
Description: Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle.
Flavor Text: Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn each time the user enters battle.

Name: Fishious Rend
Description: If the target did not deal damage in their previous turn, the power of this move is doubled.
Flavor Text: The user rends the target with its hard gills. If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.
Meta: copied from Bolt Beak. May need rebalancing

Name: Fissure
Description: Fissure has high power but its accuracy is very low. This Move may not be used more than once in succession.
Flavor Text: The user opens up a fissure in the ground and drops the target in. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
Meta: OHKO

Name: Flail
Description: Flail's base power is equal to 110 minus the user's current HP. In other words, the lower the user's HP, the higher the power.
Flavor Text: The user flails about aimlessly to attack. The less HP the user has, the greater the move’s power.
Meta: The original move can theoretically go to 200 (?) power but I think 110 is more balanced for a level 20 attack

Name: Flame Burst
Description: Flame Burst deals damage and will also cause splash damage to any Pokémon adjacent to the target (including the user if Flame Burst is targeted at an ally).
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with a bursting flame. The bursting flame damages Pokémon next to the target as well.
Meta: AOE rules changed this quite a bit. The original move couldn't be Protected against and didn't trigger side effects, whereas now it can.

Name: Flame Charge
Description: Flame Charge deals damage and raises the user's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: Cloaking itself in flame, the user attacks the target. Then, building up more power, the user raises its Speed stat.

Name: Flame Wheel
Description: Flame Wheel deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Flame Wheel can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.
Flavor Text: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges at the target. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Flamethrower
Description: Flamethrower deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Flare Blitz
Description: Flare Blitz deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or above) of burning the target, but the user receives one-third of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Flare Blitz can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.
Flavor Text: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target. This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack may leave the target with a burn.
Meta: another 1/3 calculation required

Name: Flash
Description: Flash lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user flashes a bright light that cuts the target’s accuracy.
Meta: changed to AOE to make this a little more viable

Name: Flash Cannon
Description: Flash Cannon deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it all at once. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Flatter
Description: Confuses opponent, but raises their Special Attack by two stages.
Flavor Text: Flattery is used to confuse the target. However, this also raises the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Fleur Cannon
Description: Fleur Cannon deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.
Range: A 1m x 20m line originating from the user
Flavor Text: The user unleashes a strong beam. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Fling
Description: Power depends on held item.
Flavor Text: The user flings its held item at the target to attack. This move’s power and effects depend on the item.

Name: Flip Turn
Description: After making its attack, the user swaps places with an ally Pokémon within movement range
Meta: Reinterpreted the swap out mechanic to be more like Ally Swap. Seems more interesting than just granting bonus movement

Name: Floral Healing
Description: The user restores the target's HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores 75% max HP when Grassy Terrain is active. The accuracy of Floral Healing lowers by 1 stage after each time it is used per battle, and cannot be undone by effects which would otherwise restore accuracy.
Flavor Text: The user restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass.

Name: Flower Shield
Description: Flower Shield raises the Defense of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle (including opponents) by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user raises the Defense stats of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle with a mysterious power.

Name: Fly
Description: The user of Fly will fly up high on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On their next turn, the attack lands, the user moves adjacent to their target, and the turn concludes. While in the air, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Gust, Twister, Thunder, Sky Uppercut and Smack Down, with Gust and Twister dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Fly executes in one turn. Fly can be used non-offensively to move to otherwise inaccessible areas during battle, in which case there is no attack roll.
Flavor Text: The user flies up into the sky and then strikes its target on the next turn.
Meta: Clarified how movement happens during Fly, and specifically I want to avoid being able to do hit-and-runs where you escape afterwards. Added out-of-battle use guidance.

Name: Flying Press
Description: Flying Press deals damage and its type is either Fighting or Flying, whichever one would deal more damage.
Flavor Text: The user dives down onto the target from the sky. This move is Fighting and Flying type simultaneously.
Meta: Complicated stat logic for a Hawlucha-exclusive move

Name: Focus Blast
Description: Focus Blast deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes its power. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Focus Energy
Description: All of the user's Moves which do not already use critical dice will use them for the next 3 turns
Flavor Text: The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that critical hits land more easily.
Meta: Reinterpreted increased crit chance

Name: Focus Punch
Description: The user of Focus Punch will tighten its focus and prepare a devastating punch. The punch does not strike until the beginning of the user's next turn. If any regular Move directly hits the focused Pokémon, it loses its focus does not carry out the attack. If no direct hits are made, Focus Punch attacks as normal.
Flavor Text: The user focuses its mind before launching a punch. This move fails if the user is hit before it is used.
Meta: Simplified priority rules a bit, although now this seems too easy to disrupt. Make the flinch chance a 50% roll instead of happening on any incoming hit?

Name: Follow Me
Description: All enemies of the user are unable to target a Pokémon other than the user for one full turn. They are not compelled to attack the user, but they cannot choose an alternative target either. Moves which target terrain, have an area of effect, or which already decided their target before Follow Me was used are unaffected. This Move has higher priority than most other Moves.
Flavor Text: The user draws attention to itself, making all targets take aim only at the user.

Name: Force Palm
Description: Force Palm deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with a shock wave. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Foresight
Description: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, Normal-type and Fighting-type attacks can now hit Ghosts, and Ghost-type attacks hit Normal.
Flavor Text: Enables a Ghost-type target to be hit by Normal- and Fighting-type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.

Name: Forest's Curse
