Description: Forest's Curse adds the Grass type to the target until the end of the battle. If the target is dual-typed they essentially become a triple-typed Pokémon. It fails if one of the Pokémon's types is already Grass. If the target is under the effect of Trick-or-Treat the Ghost type is replaced by Grass.
Flavor Text: The user puts a forest curse on the target. The target is now Grass type as well.

Name: Foul Play
Description: Foul Play uses the opponent's Attack stat instead of the user's in damage calculation. In other words, the move acts as if the target is attacking themselves, and thus is more powerful when the opponent has higher Attack.
Flavor Text: The user turns the target’s power against it. The higher the target’s Attack stat, the greater the damage it deals.

Name: Freeze Shock
Description: The user of Freeze Shock will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage, uses that turn's action (but not movement), and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Freeze Shock executes in one turn. This Move's target is determined at the time the attack fires, not when the Move is first used.
Flavor Text: On the second turn, the user hits the target with electrically charged ice. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
Meta: Changed to AOE and tweaked targeting rules (similar to Solar Beam) so it can't be dodged easily

Name: Freeze-Dry
Description: Freeze-Dry deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of freezing the target. In addition to Ice's usual type advantages, this move also has +20 power against Water types
Flavor Text: The user rapidly cools the target. This may also leave the target frozen. This move is super effective on Water types.
Meta: Simplified the super effective mechanic

Name: Freezing Glare
Description: 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) to freeze opponent.
Flavor Text: The user shoots its psychic power from its eyes to attack. This may also leave the target frozen.

Name: Frenzy Plant
Description: User must recharge next turn.
Flavor Text: The user slams the target with the roots of an enormous tree. The user can’t move on the next turn.

Name: Frost Breath
Description: Frost Breath deals damage and always results in a critical hit, increasing its power to 90. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effect of Lucky Chant are immune to critical hits so Frost Breath will hit them with base power 60.
Flavor Text: The user blows its cold breath on the target. This attack always results in a critical hit.

Name: Frustration
Description: The power of Frustration is higher when the Pokémon likes its trainer less. The base power varies between 1 (maximum Friendship) and 102 (minimum Friendship). The exact formula is: Power = (255 - Friendship) ÷ 2.5 Pokémon Friendship (aka Happiness) is a value between 0 and 255 (more details). Frustration is the counterpart move to Return.
Flavor Text: This full-power attack grows more powerful the less the user likes its Trainer.
Meta: Friendship is illegal now

Name: Fury Attack
Description: Fury Attack hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The target is jabbed repeatedly with a horn or beak two to five times in a row.

Name: Fury Cutter
Description: Fury Cutter deals damage starting at base power 40, and for each successful consecutive hit doubles in power, up to a maximum base power of 160. If the move misses for any reason, the base power resets to 40. This is not a multi-hit Move; each attack happens on its own turn.
Flavor Text: The target is slashed with scythes or claws. This attack becomes more powerful if it hits in succession.

Name: Fury Swipes
Description: Fury Swipes hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The target is raked with sharp claws or scythes quickly two to five times in a row.

Name: Fusion Bolt
Description: Fusion Bolt deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Flare has been used since the end of the user's last turn
Flavor Text: The user throws down a giant lightning bolt. This move’s power is increased when influenced by an enormous flame.
Meta: reinterpreted turn rules

Name: Fusion Flare
Description: Fusion Flare deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Bolt has been used since the end of the user's last turn. If the user is frozen, Fusion Flare can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.
Flavor Text: The user brings down a giant flame. This move’s power is increased when influenced by an enormous lightning bolt.
Meta: added AOE effect

Name: Future Sight
Description: The user of Future Sight foresees an attack which does not hit until the beginning of the user's 2nd turn after the Move is used. The target is fixed at the beginning of the Move, but damage and accuracy are calculated when the attack lands. Future Sight cannot be stopped by Protect, Detect, Endure or the Wonder Guard ability, and is unaffected by range, movement, or accuracy decreases due to weather or terrain. This Move may only be active once per user at a time.
Flavor Text: Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic energy attacks the target.
Meta: Nerfed a bit by only allowing one at a time

Name: Gastro Acid
Description: The target's Ability is disabled until the end of the battle.
Flavor Text: The user hurls up its stomach acids on the target. The fluid eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability.

Name: Gear Grind
Description: Gear Grind deals damage and will strike twice (with 50 base power each time). See the rules for "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by throwing steel gears at its target twice.

Name: Gear Up
Description: The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of all ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.
Range: All ally Pokémon within view which have the Plus or Minus Ability
Flavor Text: The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.

Name: Geomancy
Description: Geomancy charges on the first turn. On the second turn it raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by two stages each, using up that turn's action (but not movement). Geomancy is the signature move of Xerneas. In battle, rainbow-colored light erupts from the ground around the user.
Flavor Text: The user absorbs energy and sharply raises its Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats on the next turn.

Name: Giga Drain
Description: Giga Drain deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Flavor Text: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Giga Impact
Description: Giga Impact deals damage, but the user must recharge on the next turn (losing both movement and action). If the user has the ability Truant, it will recharge in the same turn that it loafs around. Giga Impact is the Physical counterpart to Hyper Beam.
Flavor Text: The user charges at the target using every bit of its power. The user can’t move on the next turn.

Name: Glacial Lance
Description: The user attacks by hurling a blizzard-cloaked icicle lance at opposing Pokémon.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by hurling a blizzard-cloaked icicle lance at opposing Pokémon.
Meta: limit to once per battle?

Name: Glaciate
Description: Glaciate deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by blowing freezing cold air at opposing Pokémon. This lowers their Speed stats.

Name: Glare
Description: Glare paralyzes the target, if it hits. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The user intimidates the target with the pattern on its belly to cause paralysis.

Name: Grass Knot
Description: This attack's power is based on your target's size. Against small Pokémon (less than 4 feet long) its power is 20. Against medium Pokémon (less than 10 feet long) its power is 60. Against large Pokémon its power is 120.
Flavor Text: The user snares the target with grass and trips it. The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.

Name: Grass Pledge
Description: Grass Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Fire Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear. The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting. If Grass Pledge is used with Fire Pledge, the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns. If Grass Pledge is used with Water Pledge, the move animation shows Grass Pledge and a swamp envelops the foe's team that halves the opponents' speed for 4 turns.
Flavor Text: A column of grass hits the target. When used with its water equivalent, its power increases and a vast swamp appears.

Name: Grass Whistle
Description: Grass Whistle puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
Flavor Text: The user plays a pleasant melody that lulls the target into a deep sleep.

Name: Grassy Glide
Description: High priority during Grassy Terrain.

Name: Grassy Terrain
Description: Grassy Terrain creates a low-lying grassy field lasting 5 turns, that restores the HP of grounded Pokémon each turn by 2d6. The base power of Grass type moves also increases by 50% while in effect, and the moves Earthquake, Magnitude, and Bulldoze halve in power. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Grassy Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.
Flavor Text: The user turns the ground to grass for five turns. This restores the HP of Pokémon on the ground a little every turn and powers up Grass-type moves.

Name: Grav Apple
Description: Lowers the opponent's Defense stat. (100% chance)
Flavor Text: The user inflicts damage by dropping an apple from high above. This also lowers the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Gravity
Description: Interrupts and prevents Moves like Fly, Bounce, and Sky Drop, the Levitate ability, and effects which cause the Raised status for 5 turns. All Pokémon become grounded for the duration of the effect.
Flavor Text: This move enables Flying-type Pokémon or Pokémon with the Levitate Ability to be hit by Ground-type moves. Moves that involve flying can’t be used.

Name: Growl
Description: Growl lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user growls in an endearing way, making opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their Attack stats.

Name: Growth
Description: Growth raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each. During harsh sunlight it raises each stat by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user’s body grows all at once, raising the Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

Name: Grudge
Description: If the users faints within the next turn after using this Move, the foe which landed the final blow will have that move disabled until the end of the battle
Flavor Text: If the user faints, the user’s grudge fully depletes the PP of the opponent’s move that knocked it out.

Name: Guard Split
Description: Guard Split averages the user's Defense and Special Defense with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account. For example, if the user's Defense was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used Screech on the user, then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Defense. Due to the stat drop, the Guard Split user's effective Defense would now be 75 (instead of the 50 it was originally).
Flavor Text: The user employs its psychic power to average its Defense and Sp. Def stats with those of the target.
Meta: Complex math

Name: Guard Swap
Description: Stat changes to both Defense and Special Defense are swapped with the target. For example, a -1 stage Defense and +2 stage Defense will swap between the target and user, and a 0 stage Sp. Def and a +2 stage Sp. Def will swap between the target and the user. As this affects stat changes, it can be reset by Moves which revert stat changes.
Flavor Text: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Defense and Sp. Def stats with the target.
Meta: Man this move's original description is confusing...

Name: Guillotine
Description: Guillotine has high power but its accuracy is very low. This Move may not be used more than once in succession.
Flavor Text: A vicious, tearing attack with big pincers. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
Meta: OHKO

Name: Gunk Shot
Description: Gunk Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: The user shoots filthy garbage at the target to attack. This may also poison the target.

Name: Gust
Description: Gust deals damage with no additional effect. However, it can hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stages of Bounce, Fly and Sky Drop - and in the case of Bounce and Fly, inflicts double damage.
Flavor Text: A gust of wind is whipped up by wings and launched at the target to inflict damage.

Name: Gyro Ball
Description: Gyro Ball uses the Speed stat when calculating both attack and defense.
Flavor Text: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin. The slower the user compared to the target, the greater the move’s power.
Meta: Made this into a modified Agility attack

Name: Hail
Description: Hail creates a hailstorm that lasts for 5 turns and induces these additional effects: Each Pokémon takes 2d6 damage at the end of their individual turns if they are still within the affected area, except Ice types and those with the abilities Ice Body, Magic Guard, Overcoat or Snow Cloak. This damage ignores evasion and accuracy. Accuracy of all Moves is lowered by -1 for every 5m of range (except for moves which ignore Accuracy and Evasion). The Move Aurora Veil may be used. The power of Solar Beam and Solar Blade decreases by 50%. The Moves Synthesis, Morning Sun and Moonlight recover 50% of the user's max HP (instead of the usual 25% HP). Pokémon with the ability Ice Body recover HP instead of taking damage at the end of each turn. Pokémon with the ability Slush Rush double their speed stat. Pokémon with the ability Snow Cloak increase their evasion by 1 stage. Castform changes to Snowy Form.
Flavor Text: The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns. It damages all Pokémon except Ice types.
Meta: Replaced 1/16th HP damage with the usual 2d6. Since it's 50m radius there is also a chance to escape the storm. Also added accuracy debuff similar to Misty Terrain

Name: Hammer Arm
Description: Hammer Arm deals damage but lowers the user's Speed by one stage after attacking.
Flavor Text: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user’s Speed, however.

Name: Happy Hour
Description: Happy Hour has no battle effect. Instead, it doubles the prize money awarded to the player at the end of the battle.
Flavor Text: Using Happy Hour doubles the amount of prize money received after battle.

Name: Harden
Description: Harden raises the user's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user stiffens all the muscles in its body to raise its Defense stat.

Name: Haze
Description: Resets all stat changes for all Pokémon within range. This Move does not alter status effects such as Poison.
Flavor Text: The user creates a haze that eliminates every stat change among all the Pokémon engaged in battle.

Name: Head Charge
Description: Head Charge deals damage, but the user receives 25% of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.
Flavor Text: The user charges its head into its target, using its powerful guard hair. This also damages the user a little.

Name: Head Smash
Description: Head Smash deals damage, but the user receives 50% of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 50 HP.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with a hazardous, full-power headbutt. This also damages the user terribly.

Name: Headbutt
Description: Headbutt deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging straight into the target. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Heal Bell
Description: Heals the user's party's status conditions. Stat increases and decreases do not count as status conditions. This Move also does not affect trapping moves such as Bind or Wrap
Range: Self and all allied Pokémon within view
Flavor Text: The user makes a soothing bell chime to heal the status conditions of all the party Pokémon.

Name: Heal Block
Description: Targeted opponents cannot recover HP for their next 3 turns. This includes recovery through Moves, triggered Abilities, or the use of items. Moves which have effects other than HP recovery (such as Absorb) will still retain their non-recovery effects.
Flavor Text: For five turns, the user prevents the opposing team from using any moves, Abilities, or held items that recover HP.
Meta: This is simpler if it's defined as "you can try healing but recovery won't happen". 3 turns feels about right for the duration

Name: Heal Order
Description: Heal Order recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP. The accuracy of Heal Order lowers by 1 stage after each time it is used per battle, and cannot be restored by effects which would otherwise restore accuracy.
Flavor Text: The user calls out its underlings to heal it. The user regains up to half of its max HP.

Name: Heal Pulse
Description: Heal Pulse restores half of the target's maximum HP. It can be used on team-mates but not on the user itself. The accuracy of Heal Pulse lowers by 1 stage after each time it is used per battle, and cannot be restored by effects which would otherwise restore accuracy.
Flavor Text: The user emits a healing pulse that restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP.
Meta: nerfed by decreasing accuracy after each use

Name: Healing Wish
Description: The user is faints and the targeted Pokémon is fully healed (including status effects and stat decreases).
Flavor Text: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its HP restored and status conditions cured.
Meta: I was thinking of making it reduce to 1 hp instead of fainting, but nope, it needs to be a dire situation to use this

Name: Heart Stamp
Description: Heart Stamp deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user unleashes a vicious blow after its cute act makes the target less wary. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Heart Swap
Description: Stat changes are swapped with the opponent.
Flavor Text: The user employs its psychic power to switch stat changes with the target.

Name: Heat Crash
Description: The user slams its target with its flame-covered body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move's power.
Flavor Text: The user slams its target with its flame-covered body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move’s power.

Name: Heat Wave
Description: Heat Wave deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on opposing Pokémon. This may also leave those Pokémon with a burn.

Name: Heavy Slam
Description: The user slams into the target with its heavy body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move's power.
Flavor Text: The user slams into the target with its heavy body. The more the user outweighs the target, the greater the move’s power.

Name: Helping Hand
Description: The target's next Move has a 50% higher base power. This effect does not stack.
Flavor Text: The user assists an ally by boosting the power of that ally’s attack.
Meta: Limited range and also stipulated that it can't stack

Name: Hex
Description: Hex inflicts damage, but if the target has a major status ailment (i.e. is burned, poisoned, paralyzed, asleep or frozen) it will double in power to 130.
Flavor Text: This relentless attack does massive damage to a target affected by status conditions.

Name: Hidden Power
Description: Hidden Power's Type can be any one chosen by the user at attack time.
Flavor Text: A unique attack that varies in type depending on the Pokémon using it.
Meta: Lowered power a bit to 50 to counterbalance the ability to exploit double type weaknesses

Name: High Horsepower
Description: The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body.
Flavor Text: The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body.

Name: High Jump Kick
Description: High Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, taking damage equal to 50% of their maximum HP. High Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with a knee kick from a jump. If it misses, the user is hurt instead.

Name: Hold Back
Description: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.
Flavor Text: The user holds back when it attacks, and the target is left with at least 1 HP.

Name: Hold Hands
Description: Makes the user and an ally very happy.
Flavor Text: The user and an ally hold hands. This makes them very happy.

Name: Hone Claws
Description: Hone Claws raises the user's Attack and Accuracy by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user sharpens its claws to boost its Attack stat and accuracy.

Name: Horn Attack
Description: Horn Attack deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed horn to inflict damage.

Name: Horn Drill
Description: Horn Drill has high power but its accuracy is very low. This Move may not be used more than once in succession.
Flavor Text: The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates like a drill. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.
Meta: OHKO

Name: Horn Leech
Description: Horn Leech deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Flavor Text: The user drains the target’s energy with its horns. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Howl
Description: Howl raises the Attack of the user and its teammates by one stage.
Range: Self and all ally Pokémon within 10m
Flavor Text: The user howls loudly to raise the spirit of itself and allies. This raises their Attack stats.

Name: Hurricane
Description: Hurricane deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. If used during rain, Hurricane ignores accuracy. Conversely, if used during intense sunlight, its accuracy drops to 7. Hurricane can hit Pokémon in the invulnerable stage of Fly and Bounce.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by wrapping its opponent in a fierce wind that flies up into the sky. This may also confuse the target.
Meta: Changed to AOE

Name: Hydro Cannon
Description: User must recharge next turn.
Flavor Text: The target is hit with a watery blast. The user can’t move on the next turn.

Name: Hydro Pump
Description: Hydro Pump deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is blasted by a huge volume of water launched under great pressure.

Name: Hyper Beam
Description: Hyper Beam deals damage, but the user must recharge on the next turn (losing both movement and action). If the user has the ability Truant, it will recharge in the same turn that it loafs around. Hyper Beam is the Special counterpart to Giga Impact.
Range: 1m x 20m line originating from the user
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user can’t move on the next turn.
Meta: changed to line and clarified loss of movement

Name: Hyper Fang
Description: Hyper Fang deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user bites hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This may also make the target flinch.
Meta: changed to agility attack

Name: Hyper Voice
Description: Hyper Voice deals damage with no additional effect, besides targeting multiple foes. Hyper Voice has no effect on Pokémon with the ability Soundproof.
Flavor Text: The user lets loose a horribly echoing shout with the power to inflict damage.

Name: Hyperspace Fury
Description: Hyperspace Fury deals damage but lowers the user's Defense by one stage after attacking. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move. Hyperspace Fury is the signature move of Hoopa Unbound.
Flavor Text: Using its many arms, the user unleashes a barrage of attacks that ignore the effects of moves like Protect and Detect. But the user’s Defense stat falls.

Name: Hyperspace Hole
Description: Hyperspace Hole deals damage and always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move. It is the signature move of Hoopa.
Flavor Text: Using a hyperspace hole, the user appears right next to the target and strikes. This also hits a target using a move such as Protect or Detect.

Name: Hypnosis
Description: Hypnosis puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move or act(with some exceptions such as Snore). Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
Flavor Text: The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the target fall into a deep sleep.

Name: Ice Ball
Description: The user of Ice Ball attacks for 5 turns (including this one), doubling in power each turn. The user must declare and lock in the next target of Ice Ball at the end of each of their turns. The user loses their regular action and must move towards their intended target on each turn. The user cannot cancel the move on their own. However, if Ice Ball is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses, the user flinches, the user cannot attack due to paralysis, or no more targets are within range) then it will stop. If it doesn't miss, Ice Ball will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively. If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn this battle then Ice Ball doubles in power, i.e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target for five turns. The move’s power increases each time it hits.
Meta: copied from Rollout

Name: Ice Beam
Description: Ice Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of freezing the target. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.
Range: 1m x 20m line originating from the user
Flavor Text: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. This may also leave the target frozen.

Name: Ice Burn
Description: The user of Ice Burn will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of burning the target, after which the turn ends. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Ice Burn executes in one turn.
Flavor Text: On the second turn, an ultracold, freezing wind surrounds the target. This may leave the target with a burn.

Name: Ice Fang
Description: Ice Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of freezing the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user bites with cold-infused fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it frozen.

Name: Ice Hammer
Description: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. Afterwards, it lowers the user's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user’s Speed, however.

Name: Ice Punch
Description: Ice Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rols 19 or higher) of freezing the target. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.
Flavor Text: The target is punched with an icy fist. This may also leave the target frozen.

Name: Ice Shard
Description: Ice Shard deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Flavor Text: The user flash-freezes chunks of ice and hurls them at the target. This move always goes first.

Name: Icicle Crash
Description: Icicle Crash deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by harshly dropping large icicles onto the target. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Icicle Spear
Description: Icicle Spear hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user launches sharp icicles at the target two to five times in a row.

Name: Icy Wind
Description: Icy Wind deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Range: All Pokémon in a 90 degree cone extending forwards 15m
Flavor Text: The user attacks with a gust of chilled air. This also lowers opposing Pokémon’s Speed stats.
Meta: This is pretty much Cone of Cold now

Name: Imprison
Description: Opponent is unable to use moves that the user also knows until the end of the battle. Moves which revert status effects such as Heal Bell will also undo this effect.
Flavor Text: If opposing Pokémon know any move also known by the user, they are prevented from using it.
Meta: any way to cure?

Name: Incinerate
Description: Incinerate deals damage and if the target is holding a Berry, it is burnt and becomes no longer usable. If Incinerate would be super-effective and the target is holding an Occa Berry, the Berry activates before the move hits so does not get burnt.
Flavor Text: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with fire. If a Pokémon is holding a certain item, such as a Berry, the item becomes burned up and unusable.
Meta: changed to AOE

Name: Inferno
Description: Inferno deals damage and burns the target, if it hits. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by engulfing the target in an intense fire. This leaves the target with a burn.

Name: Infestation
Description: Infestation inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The target is infested and attacked for four to five turns. The target can’t flee during this time.

Name: Ingrain
Description: The user of Ingrain plants it roots, which restores 3d6 HP at the end of each succeeding turn, and prevents all movement. The user can perform other Moves while rooted. This effect can be canceled by the user during any of their succeeding turns (but only during their turn). Attempts to forcibly move the user (such as with Telekinesis) will have no effect. Ingrain cancels effects given to raised Pokémon such as immunity to Ground-type moves, Spikes and so on.
Flavor Text: The user lays roots that restore its HP on every turn. Because it’s rooted, it can’t switch out.
Meta: reinterpreted "can't switch" to be "can't move" and made it cancelable at will. Does it heal on the turn it is used? What moves can force movement on an opponent? Circle Throw? Sky Drop?

Name: Instruct
Description: A Move which the user knows is executed by a teammate on this turn, using that teammate's stats, type, and current position. The Move must be one the user is currently able to perform (i.e. it is not Disabled, recharging, etc.). The teammate must not be fainted or in the middle of executing another Move, and they must also meet the Move's minimum level requirement. Effects which would normally happen to the user (such as recoil, stat decreases, or status effects) would instead happen to the teammate.
Flavor Text: The user instructs the target to use the target’s last move again.
Meta: If I interpreted the effect straight this would be identical to After You, so I tried to invent something more interesting

Name: Ion Deluge
Description: Ion Deluge changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type for all Pokémon on the field, until the beginning of the user's next turn.
Flavor Text: The user disperses electrically charged particles, which changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.

Name: Iron Defense
Description: Iron Defense raises the user's Defense by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user hardens its body’s surface like iron, sharply raising its Defense stat.

Name: Iron Head
Description: Iron Head deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user slams the target with its steel-hard head. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Iron Tail
Description: Iron Tail deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Jaw Lock
Description: The user locks firmly onto their target, preventing all normal movement and action by either of them. The trapped Pokémon may not use Moves which target anything besides themselves. They can, however, attempt to break the lock at the start of their turn by rolling a d20 of 15 or higher. The attacker must use their action on each turn to maintain the lock, otherwise the effect ends.
Flavor Text: This move prevents the user and the target from switching out until either of them faints. The effect goes away if either of the Pokémon leaves the field.
Meta: I want to make this one interesting but it's hard to balance. As it is now it feels like a regular Trap move like Bind, but worse

Name: Judgment
Description: This move's Type depends on the Arceus Plate being held.
Flavor Text: The user releases countless shots of light at the target. This move’s type varies depending on the kind of Plate the user is holding.

Name: Jump Kick
Description: Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, losing 50% of its maximum HP. Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.
Flavor Text: The user jumps up high, then strikes with a kick. If the kick misses, the user hurts itself.

Name: Jungle Healing
Description: The user becomes one with the jungle, restoring 25% of the max HP and healing any status conditions of itself and its ally Pokémon in battle. This Move's accuracy decreases by one stage after each time it is used until the end of the battle, and cannot be restored by effects which normally change accuracy.
Range: Self and all ally Pokémon within 10m
Meta: nerfed like Heal Pulse to decrease accuracy over time

Name: Karate Chop
Description: Karate Chop deals damage and uses critical dice.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with a sharp chop. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Kinesis
Description: Kinesis lowers the target's Accuracy by two stages. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user distracts the target by bending a spoon. This sharply lowers the target’s accuracy.

Name: King's Shield
Description: King's Shield prevents any Physical or Special attacks targeted at the user from striking, until the beginning of the user's next turn. If a contact move is targeted at the King's Shield user, the opponent's Attack is lowered by two stages. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The accuracy of King's Shield drops by 1 stage each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Baneful Bunker.
Flavor Text: The user takes a defensive stance while it protects itself from damage. It also lowers the Attack stat of any attacker that makes direct contact.

Name: Knock Off
Description: Knock Off deals damage and if the target has a held item, damage is increased to 100 and the item is knocked away onto the ground. If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being knocked off. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be knocked off. Pokémon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. The damage increase only applies if the item is knocked away.
Flavor Text: The user slaps down the target’s held item, and that item can’t be used in that battle. The move does more damage if the target has a held item.

Name: Land's Wrath
Description: Land's Wrath deals damage with no additional effects.
Flavor Text: The user gathers the energy of the land and focuses that power on opposing Pokémon to damage them.

Name: Laser Focus
Description: The user's next attack is guaranteed to be a critical hit (it uses critical dice if it did not already do so).
Flavor Text: The user concentrates intensely. The attack on the next turn always results in a critical hit.

Name: Lash Out
Description: The user lashes out to vent its frustration toward the target. If the user's stats were lowered since their last turn, the power of this move is doubled.

Name: Last Resort
Description: Last Resort deals high damage, but will fail if the user has not used each of its other moves at least once (or has no other moves).
Flavor Text: This move can be used only after the user has used all the other moves it knows in the battle.

Name: Lava Plume
Description: Lava Plume deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The user torches everything around it in an inferno of scarlet flames. This may also leave those it hits with a burn.

Name: Leaf Blade
Description: Leaf Blade deals damage and uses critical dice
Flavor Text: The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword and attacks by cutting its target. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Leaf Storm
Description: Leaf Storm deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.
Flavor Text: The user whips up a storm of leaves around the target. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Leaf Tornado
Description: Leaf Tornado deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user attacks its target by encircling it in sharp leaves. This attack may also lower the target’s accuracy.

Name: Leafage
Description: Strikes opponent with leaves.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by pelting the target with leaves.

Name: Leech Life
Description: Leech Life deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Flavor Text: The user drains the target’s blood. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Leech Seed
Description: Leech Seed plants a seed on the target that drains 2d6 of its HP at the end of each of their turns and restores it to the user. It does not work on Grass-type Pokémon. If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. The seeded Pokémon can clear Leech Seed the same as most other status effects, or by using Rapid Spin.
Flavor Text: A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP from the target every turn.

Name: Leer
Description: Leer lowers the target's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating leer that lowers the Defense stat.

Name: Lick
Description: Lick deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The target is licked with a long tongue, causing damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Life Dew
Description: Life Dew recovers up to 25% of the user's and its teammate's maximum HP.
Range: Self and all ally Pokémon within 10m
Flavor Text: The user scatters mysterious water around and restores the HP of itself and its ally Pokémon in the battle.

Name: Light of Ruin
Description: Light of Ruin deals damage, but the user receives half of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 50 HP.
Flavor Text: Drawing power from the Eternal Flower, the user fires a powerful beam of light. This also damages the user quite a lot.

Name: Light Screen
Description: Light Screen creates a static spherical barrier around the user which reduces incoming damage from Special attacks by 50%, for 5 turns. If the user is holding Light Clay when Light Screen is used, its effects last for 8 turns. Attacks originating from within the bubble are unaffected. Pokémon can freely move in and out of the bubble. The move Brick Break, when used against a Pokémon behind the Light Screen's effect, will remove the screen before dealing damage. The ability Infiltrator bypasses the effects of Light Screen. Light Screen is the Special counterpart to Reflect.
Flavor Text: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from special attacks for five turns.
Meta: I considered having it be a personal force field around each ally, but it's more narratively interesting if it was like a Halo bubble shield

Name: Liquidation
Description: Has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) to lower opponent's Defense
Flavor Text: The user slams into the target using a full-force blast of water. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Lock-On
Description: The user's next attack against the targeted Pokémon is guaranteed to hit.
Flavor Text: The user takes sure aim at the target. This ensures the next attack does not miss the target.

Name: Lovely Kiss
Description: Lovely Kiss puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
Flavor Text: With a scary face, the user tries to force a kiss on the target. If it succeeds, the target falls asleep.

Name: Low Kick
Description: This attack's power is based on your target's size. Against small Pokémon (less than 4 feet long) its power is 20. Against medium Pokémon (less than 10 feet long) its power is 60. Against large Pokémon its power is 120. Low Kick is also able to hit opponents hidden underwater from using Dive.
Flavor Text: A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over. The heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.

Name: Low Sweep
Description: Low Sweep deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user makes a swift attack on the target’s legs, which lowers the target’s Speed stat.

Name: Lucky Chant
Description: Opponent cannot land critical hits on the user or any of its allies for 5 turns.
Range: Self and all allies within view
Flavor Text: The user chants an incantation toward the sky, preventing opposing Pokémon from landing critical hits for five turns.

Name: Lunar Dance
Description: The user faints, and the targeted Pokémon is fully healed. Status effects and debuffs are also removed from the target.
Flavor Text: The user faints. In return, the Pokémon taking its place will have its status and HP fully restored.

Name: Lunge
Description: The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target's Attack stat. (100% chance)
Flavor Text: The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target’s Attack stat.

Name: Luster Purge
Description: Luster Purge deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user lets loose a damaging burst of light. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Mach Punch
Description: Mach Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Flavor Text: The user throws a punch at blinding speed. This move always goes first.

Name: Magic Coat
Description: Magic Coat reflects any move causing status conditions - for example Thunder Wave or Toxic - back to the attacker, until the beginning of the user's next turn. This includes Moves which cause the Trapped status such as Wrap, Flame Wheel, Thunder Cage, etc.
Flavor Text: Moves like Leech Seed and moves that inflict status conditions are blocked by a barrier and reflected back to the user of those moves.

Name: Magic Powder
Description: Changes target's type to Psychic, overridding any existing type(s).
Flavor Text: The user scatters a cloud of magic powder that changes the target to Psychic type.

Name: Magic Room
Description: Magic Room suppresses the effects of held items for all Pokémon for five turns.
Flavor Text: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon’s held items lose their effects for five turns.

Name: Magical Leaf
Description: Magical Leaf deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: The user scatters curious leaves that chase the target. This attack never misses.

Name: Magma Storm
Description: Magma Storm inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The target becomes trapped within a maelstrom of fire that rages for four to five turns.

Name: Magnet Bomb
Description: Magnet Bomb deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: The user launches steel bombs that stick to the target. This attack never misses.

Name: Magnet Rise
Description: User becomes Raised and immune to Ground-type moves for 5 turns. This effect cannot be reverted normally except by certain Moves such as Gravity and Smack Down
Flavor Text: The user levitates using electrically generated magnetism for five turns.

Name: Magnetic Flux
Description: Magnetic Flux raises the Defense and Special Defense of all Pokémon on the user's team that have the Plus or Minus ability.
Range: All ally Pokémon within view which have the Plus or Minus ability
Flavor Text: The user manipulates magnetic fields, which raises the Defense and Sp. Def stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.

Name: Magnitude
Description: Magnitude's base power is equal to 2d6 x 10. Magnitude will also hit with double power if the opponent is underground due to the move Dig.
Flavor Text: The user attacks everything around it with a ground-shaking quake. Its power varies.

Name: Mat Block
Description: Mat Block protects the user's adjacent teammates from Physical or Special category moves, but not Status moves, until the beginning of the user's next turn. It only works on the first turn the user is in battle.
Flavor Text: Using a pulled-up mat as a shield, the user protects itself and its allies from damaging moves. This does not stop status moves.
Meta: I assume it only takes effect for one turn

Name: Me First
Description: If the opponent is preparing a delayed attack (such as Solar Beam), the user of Me First will copy it and attack immediately with 50% more base power. Me First cannot copy Sucker Punch or Fake Out, nor by its definition above any high priority move such as Extreme Speed. However it can copy a multi-turn move from any of its turns. The copied move's statistics are applied exactly as written except for the increased power. So, for example, the move's Type is as written and S.T.A.B. applies if the user matches that type.
Flavor Text: The user cuts ahead of the target to copy and use the target’s intended move with greater power. This move fails if it isn’t used first.

Name: Mean Look
Description: The target becomes unable to move normally on their turn until they resolve the Terrified status effect.
Flavor Text: The user pins the target with a dark, arresting look. The target becomes unable to flee.
Meta: Originally I had this as "can't move for 2 turns", but I think converting it into a status effect plays more into the rest of the game's mechanics

Name: Meditate
Description: Meditate raises the user's Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user meditates to awaken the power deep within its body and raise its Attack stat.

Name: Mega Drain
Description: Mega Drain deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Flavor Text: A nutrient-draining attack. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

Name: Mega Kick
Description: Mega Kick deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked by a kick launched with muscle-packed power.

Name: Mega Punch
Description: Mega Punch deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-packed power.

Name: Megahorn
Description: Megahorn deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: Using its tough and impressive horn, the user rams into the target with no letup.

Name: Memento
Description: User faints, and sharply lowers opponent's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages
Flavor Text: The user faints when using this move. In return, this harshly lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
Meta: this move sounds...unviable. I guess enemies can use it?

Name: Metal Burst
Description: The last Pokémon to hit the user is struck with a typeless Physical attack with damage 50% greater than what was originally inflicted on the user. This attack ignores the target's defense, but can be dodged or mitigated by effects such as Reflect
Flavor Text: The user retaliates with much greater force against the opponent that last inflicted damage on it.
Meta: The Steel typing of the attack isn't implemented, so resistance or weakness to steel is ignored...

Name: Metal Claw
Description: Metal Claw deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of raising the user's Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The target is raked with steel claws. This may also raise the user’s Attack stat.

Name: Metal Sound
Description: Metal Sound lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages. Those with the ability Soundproof are unaffected.
Flavor Text: A horrible sound like scraping metal harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Meteor Assault
Description: User must recharge next turn.
Flavor Text: The user attacks wildly with its thick leek. The user can’t move on the next turn, because the force of this move makes it stagger.

Name: Meteor Beam
Description: The user of Meteor Beam will gather space power on the first turn, increasing their Special Attack by one stage. On the second turn, Meteor Beam deals damage and uses that turn's action (but not movement). This Move's target is determined at the time the beam fires, not when the Move is first used. When holding a Power Herb, Meteor Beam executes in one turn.
Range: 1m x 20m line originating from the user
Flavor Text: User gathers space power and boosts its Sp. Atk stat, then attacks the target on the next turn.

Name: Meteor Mash
Description: Meteor Mash deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of raising the user's Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The target is hit with a hard punch fired like a meteor. This may also raise the user’s Attack stat.

Name: Milk Drink
Description: Milk Drink recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
Flavor Text: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP.

Name: Mimic
Description: Mimic copies the last Move used by the target. The user must meet the Move's minimum level requirement. Mimic cannot copy Chatter, Metronome, Sketch, Mirror Move, or Struggle.
Flavor Text: The user copies the target’s last move. The move can be used during battle until the Pokémon is switched out.
Meta: removing the behavior of "you temporarily learn the move"

Name: Mind Blown
Description: Mind Blown deals damage, but the user sacrifices one half of its maximum HP in recoil.
Flavor Text: The user attacks everything around it by causing its own head to explode. This also damages the user.

Name: Mind Reader
Description: The user's next attack against the target is guaranteed to hit.
Flavor Text: The user senses the target’s movements with its mind to ensure its next attack does not miss the target.

Name: Minimize
Description: Minimize raises the user's Evasion by two stages, thus making the user more difficult to hit. The following Moves do extra damage against Minimized targets and bypass accuracy checks: Body Slam, Dragon Rush, Flying Press, Heat Crash, Heavy Slam, Steamroller, Stomp
Flavor Text: The user compresses its body to make itself look smaller, which sharply raises its evasiveness.

Name: Miracle Eye
Description: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, removes Dark's Psychic immunity.
Flavor Text: Enables a Dark-type target to be hit by Psychic-type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.

Name: Mirror Coat
Description: If the user is hit by a Special Attack before the start of their next turn, the user strikes back with a Psychic-type attack with 2x of that move's base power.
Flavor Text: A retaliation move that counters any special attack, inflicting double the damage taken.
Meta: copied from Counter

Name: Mirror Move
Description: Mirror Move copies the last Move used by the target. The user must meet the Move's minimum level requirement. Mirror Move cannot copy Chatter, Metronome, Sketch, Mimic, or Struggle.
Flavor Text: The user counters the target by mimicking the target’s last move.
Meta: so this is identical to mimic I guess

Name: Mirror Shot
Description: Mirror Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user lets loose a flash of energy at the target from its polished body. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.

Name: Mist
Description: The stats of the user and nearby allies cannot be lowered for 5 turns.
Flavor Text: The user cloaks itself and its allies in a white mist that prevents any of their stats from being lowered for five turns.

Name: Mist Ball
Description: Mist Ball deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: A mist-like flurry of down envelops and damages the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Misty Explosion
Description: The user attacks everything around it and faints upon using this move. This move’s power is increased to 150 on Misty Terrain.
Flavor Text: The user attacks everything around it and faints upon using this move. This move's power is increased on Misty Terrain.

Name: Misty Terrain
Description: Misty Terrain creates a low-lying mist lasting 5 turns, that protects all grounded Pokémon from being hit with status conditions (including confusion). It also halves the power of Dragon type Moves while in effect. Accuracy of all Moves is lowered by -1 for every 5m of range (except for Moves which ignore Accuracy and Evasion). Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Misty Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions. Status conditions in effect when Misty Terrain is used continue as normal.
Flavor Text: This protects Pokémon on the ground from status conditions and halves damage from Dragon-type moves for five turns.
Meta: added accuracy debuff and clarified that existing status effects continue

Name: Moonblast
Description: Moonblast deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: Borrowing the power of the moon, the user attacks the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Moongeist Beam
Description: This Move ignores the target's Ability.
Flavor Text: The user emits a sinister ray to attack the target. This move can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

Name: Moonlight
Description: The user recovers 50% of their maximum HP. If it is currently nighttime, this increases to 75%. If Rain, Hail, or Sandstorm is in effect, this decreases to 25%.
Flavor Text: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
Meta: Same as Synthesis, but added "if it is nighttime" clause that doesn't directly map to weather moves

Name: Morning Sun
Description: The user recovers 50% of their maximum HP. If Sunny Day is active, this increases to 75%. If Rain, Hail, or Sandstorm is in effect, this decreases to 25%.
Flavor Text: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
Meta: Same as Synthesis

Name: Mud Bomb
Description: Mud Bomb deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user launches a hard-packed mud ball to attack. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.

Name: Mud Shot
Description: Mud Shot deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by hurling a blob of mud at the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat.

Name: Mud Sport
Description: Mud Sport reduces the power of Electric type moves by 50%. The effect applies to the entire field. Most Pokémon that learn Mud Sport are part Ground type and thus already immune to Electric attacks.
Flavor Text: The user kicks up mud on the battlefield. This weakens Electric-type moves for five turns.

Name: Mud-Slap
Description: Mud-Slap deals damage and lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user hurls mud in the target’s face to inflict damage and lower its accuracy.

Name: Muddy Water
Description: Muddy Water deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by shooting muddy water at opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their accuracy.

Name: Multi-Attack
Description: Multi-Attack is the signature move of Silvally. It deals damage with its type matching the Memory item held.
Flavor Text: Cloaking itself in high energy, the user slams into the target. The memory held determines the move’s type.

Name: Mystical Fire
Description: Mystical Fire deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by breathing a special, hot fire. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Nasty Plot
Description: Nasty Plot raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad thoughts. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Natural Gift
Description: Natural Gift deals damage with no additional effects. However, its type and base power vary depending on the user's held Berry.
Flavor Text: The user draws power to attack by using its held Berry. The Berry determines the move’s type and power.

Name: Nature Power
Description: Nature Power's Type is based on the surrounding environment, at the GM's judgment.
Flavor Text: This attack makes use of nature’s power. Its effects vary depending on the user’s environment.

Name: Nature's Madness
Description: The target's HP is reduced by 50%.
Flavor Text: The user hits the target with the force of nature. It halves the target’s HP.
Meta: overpowered against bosses?

Name: Needle Arm
Description: Needle Arm deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by wildly swinging its thorny arms. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Night Daze
Description: Night Daze deals damage and has a 40% chance (a d20 rolls 13 or higher) of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user lets loose a pitch-black shock wave at its target. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.

Name: Night Shade
Description: The damage of Night Shade is equal to the user's level. So at level 100 the Pokémon will inflict 100 HP damage.
Flavor Text: The user makes the target see a frightening mirage. It inflicts damage equal to the user’s level.

Name: Night Slash
Description: Night Slash deals damage and uses critical dice
Flavor Text: The user slashes the target the instant an opportunity arises. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Nightmare
Description: If the target is asleep, Nightmare causes it to take 3d6 damage at the end of each of its turns. The status condition is only cured when the Pokémon wakes up.
Flavor Text: A sleeping target sees a nightmare that inflicts some damage every turn.
Meta: changed to 3d6 damage and specified that it can't be cured with a regular status roll naturally

Name: No Retreat
Description: Raises all stats by one stage, but the user loses their movement for their next 3 turns.
Flavor Text: This move raises all the user’s stats but prevents the user from switching out or fleeing.

Name: Noble Roar
Description: Noble Roar lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.
Flavor Text: Letting out a noble roar, the user intimidates the target and lowers its Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

Name: Nuzzle
Description: Nuzzle deals damage and paralyzes the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by nuzzling its electrified cheeks against the target. This also leaves the target with paralysis.

Name: Oblivion Wing
Description: Oblivion Wing deals damage and the user will recover 75% of the HP drained. Oblivion Wing is the signature move of Yveltal. In battle, the user flies high into the sky then releases a beam of red light that scorches the ground.
Flavor Text: The user absorbs its target’s HP. The user’s HP is restored by over half of the damage taken by the target.

Name: Obstruct
Description: Obstruct causes any attacks targeted at the user to have 0% accuracy, until the beginning of their next turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. If a contact move is targeted at the user during this time, the attacker's Defense is lowered by two stages. The move is similar to Detect only with an added debuff on attackers. The accuracy of Obstruct decreases by one stage each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker. Moves with infinite accuracy or under effects such as Mind Reader can still bypass Obstruct.
Flavor Text: This move enables the user to protect itself from all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession. Direct contact harshly lowers the attacker’s Defense stat.
Meta: copied from Detect

Name: Octazooka
Description: Octazooka deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by spraying ink in the target’s face or eyes. This may also lower the target’s accuracy.

Name: Octolock
Description: Octolock is a Trap move which does not deal damage. However, it lowers the target's Defense and Special Defense by one stage at the beginning of each of the user's turns. See the rules for "Trap Moves" for more details.
Flavor Text: The user locks the target in and prevents it from fleeing. This move also lowers the target’s Defense and Sp. Def every turn.

Name: Odor Sleuth
Description: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, Normal-type and Fighting-type attacks can now hit Ghosts, and Ghost-type attacks hit Normal.
Flavor Text: Enables a Ghost-type target to be hit by Normal- and Fighting-type attacks. This also enables an evasive target to be hit.

Name: Ominous Wind
Description: Ominous Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user blasts the target with a gust of repulsive wind. This may also raise all the user’s stats at once.

Name: Origin Pulse
Description: Origin Pulse deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents. It is the signature move of Kyogre.
Flavor Text: The user attacks opposing Pokémon with countless beams of light that glow a deep and brilliant blue.

Name: Outrage
Description: The user of Outrage attacks for 3 turns (including this one), during which it loses its regular action (but not movement), and then becomes confused. A new target may be chosen for each attack. The user cannot cancel the move on their own. However, if Outrage is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses, the user flinches, the user cannot attack due to paralysis, or no more targets are within range) then it will stop and not cause confusion. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
Meta: Allowing movement in between so the user can chase opponents, and clarified what can stop it

Name: Overdrive
Description: Overdrive has no effect on Pokémon with the Soundproof ability
Flavor Text: The user attacks opposing Pokémon by twanging a guitar or bass guitar, causing a huge echo and strong vibration.

Name: Overheat
Description: Overheat deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Pain Split
Description: The user's and opponent's HP becomes the average of both (capped by their respective maximum HP values)
Flavor Text: The user adds its HP to the target’s HP, then equally shares the combined HP with the target.
Meta: I guess this is fine?

Name: Parabolic Charge
Description: Parabolic Charge deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. It targets all adjacent Pokémon.
Flavor Text: The user attacks everything around it. The user’s HP is restored by half the damage taken by those hit.

Name: Parting Shot
Description: Parting Shot lowers the opponent's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each. The user is then immediately given a bonus movement action.
Flavor Text: With a parting threat, the user lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats. Then it switches with a party Pokémon.

Name: Pay Day
Description: A small amount of money is gained after the battle resolves.
Flavor Text: Numerous coins are hurled at the target to inflict damage. Money is earned after the battle.

Name: Payback
Description: This Move strikes at the beginning of the user's next turn. If the user has taken damage during that time, the Move's power is doubled.
Flavor Text: The user stores power, then attacks. If the user moves after the target, this attack’s power will be doubled.

Name: Peck
Description: Peck deals damage with no additional effect
Flavor Text: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed beak or horn.
Meta: shortened range

Name: Perish Song
Description: Any Pokémon in play when this attack is used faints in 3 turns.
Flavor Text: Any Pokémon that hears this song faints in three turns, unless it switches out of battle.
Meta: overpowered maybe?

Name: Petal Blizzard
Description: Petal Blizzard deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The user stirs up a violent petal blizzard and attacks everything around it.
Meta: changed to AOE

Name: Petal Dance
Description: The user of Petal Dance attacks for 3 turns (including this one), during which it loses its regular action (but not movement), and then becomes confused. A new target may be chosen for each attack. The user cannot cancel the move on their own. However, if Petal Dance is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses, the user flinches, the user cannot attack due to paralysis, or no more targets are within range) then it will stop and not cause confusion. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target by scattering petals for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.
Meta: copied from Outrage

Name: Phantom Force
Description: Phantom Force causes the user to disappear on the first turn, becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, it deals damage and can hit Pokémon using Protect or Detect. The user moves adjacent to their target, and the turn ends.
Flavor Text: The user vanishes somewhere, then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.

Name: Photon Geyser
Description: Photon Geyser deals damage, but uses either the user's Attack or Special Attack stat to determine its power, whichever is higher.
Flavor Text: The user attacks a target with a pillar of light. This move inflicts Attack or Sp. Atk damage—whichever stat is higher for the user.

Name: Pin Missile
Description: Pin Missile hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.

Name: Plasma Fists
Description: On a successful hit, all of the target's Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves until the battle ends.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with electrically charged fists. This move changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.

Name: Play Nice
Description: Play Nice lowers the target's Attack by one stage. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move.
Flavor Text: The user and the target become friends, and the target loses its will to fight. This lowers the target’s Attack stat.

Name: Play Rough
Description: Play Rough deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of lowering the target's Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user plays rough with the target and attacks it. This may also lower the target’s Attack stat.

Name: Pluck
Description: If the opponent is holding a berry, it is stolen and eaten by the user.
Flavor Text: The user pecks the target. If the target is holding a Berry, the user eats it and gains its effect.

Name: Poison Fang
Description: Poison Fang deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of badly poisoning the target. Badly poisoned Pokémon will lose an increasing amount of HP at the end of each turn (see rules for "Toxic")
Flavor Text: The user bites the target with toxic fangs. This may also leave the target badly poisoned.

Name: Poison Gas
Description: Poison Gas causes the target to become poisoned. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: A cloud of poison gas is sprayed in the face of opposing Pokémon, poisoning those it hits.
Meta: changed to indiscriminate AOE

Name: Poison Jab
Description: Poison Jab deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.

Name: Poison Powder
Description: Poison Powder causes the target to become poisoned. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: The user scatters a cloud of poisonous dust that poisons the target.

Name: Poison Sting
Description: Poison Sting deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger. This may also poison the target.

Name: Poison Tail
Description: Poison Tail deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of poisoning the target. It also uses critical dice. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: The user hits the target with its tail. This may also poison the target. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Pollen Puff
Description: If used on an ally, this attack restores health instead of damaging (you will still roll as though it were an attack in that case)
Flavor Text: The user attacks the enemy with a pollen puff that explodes. If the target is an ally, it gives the ally a pollen puff that restores its HP instead.

Name: Poltergeist
Description: The user attacks the target by controlling the target’s item. The move fails if the target doesn’t have an item.

Name: Pound
Description: Pound deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is physically pounded with a long tail, a foreleg, or the like.

Name: Powder
Description: Powder moves with priority and covers the target in a powder that lasts until the end of their next turn. It inflicts 4d6 damage on the target if they use a Fire type move during that time, and prevents the Fire move from working.
Flavor Text: The user covers the target in a combustible powder. If the target uses a Fire-type move, the powder explodes and damages the target.

Name: Powder Snow
Description: Powder Snow deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of freezing the target. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with a chilling gust of powdery snow. This may also freeze opposing Pokémon.

Name: Power Gem
Description: Power Gem deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with a ray of light that sparkles as if it were made of gemstones.

Name: Power Split
Description: Power Split averages the user's Attack and Special Attack with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account. The effect lasts until the battle ends or the Pokémon switches out. For example, if the user's Attack was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used Swords Dance, then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Attack. Due to the stat boost, the opponent's effective Attack would now be 300 (instead of the 400 it was originally).
Flavor Text: The user employs its psychic power to average its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with those of the target.

Name: Power Swap
Description: Stat changes to both Attack and Special Attack are swapped with the target. For example, a -1 stage Attack and +2 stage Attack will swap between the target and user, and a 0 stage Sp. Atk and a +2 stage Sp. Atk will swap between the target and the user. As this affects stat changes, it can be reset by Moves which revert stat changes.
Flavor Text: The user employs its psychic power to switch changes to its Attack and Sp. Atk stats with the target.

Name: Power Trick
Description: User's own Attack and Defense switch until the end of the battle
Flavor Text: The user employs its psychic power to switch its Attack stat with its Defense stat.

Name: Power Trip
Description: This move's power is 20 plus an additional 20 for every stage that one of the user's stats are boosted. Stat decreases do not affect the power.
Flavor Text: The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user’s stats are raised, the greater the move’s power.

Name: Power Whip
Description: Power Whip deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The user violently whirls its vines, tentacles, or the like to harshly lash the target.

Name: Power-Up Punch
Description: Power-Up Punch deals damage and raises the user's Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: Striking opponents over and over makes the user’s fists harder. Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

Name: Precipice Blades
Description: Precipice Blades deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents. It is the signature move of Groudon.
Flavor Text: The user attacks opposing Pokémon by manifesting the power of the land in fearsome blades of stone.

Name: Present
Description: Roll a d20. On 6 or above, this Move deals damage. Otherwise, it heals equal to half the damage it would have done, rounded down.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by giving the target a gift with a hidden trap. It restores HP sometimes, however.

Name: Protect
Description: Protect negates the damage and inficted statuses of any attacks which strike the user, until the beginning of their next turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The move functions similarly to Detect, however, in the case of Protect the attack will still land and potentially trigger additional effects from the contact. The accuracy of Protect decreases by one stage each time it is used consecutively after itself or Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker.
Flavor Text: This move enables the user to protect itself from all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
Meta: Clarifies that the attack still hits, but Protect negates most of the effects.

Name: Prismatic Laser
Description: The user shoots powerful lasers using the power of a prism. The user can't move on the next turn.
Range: 1m x 20m line originating from the user
