Flavor Text: The user shoots powerful lasers using the power of a prism. The user can’t move on the next turn.

Name: Psybeam
Description: Psybeam deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or 20) of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may also leave the target confused.

Name: Psych Up
Description: Copies the target's stat changes.
Flavor Text: The user hypnotizes itself into copying any stat change made by the target.

Name: Psychic
Description: Psychic deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Psychic Fangs
Description: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect if the target is behind them.
Flavor Text: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect.

Name: Psychic Terrain
Description: Psychic Terrain creates a low-lying psychic field lasting 5 turns, that prevents high-priority moves (such as Quick Attack or Sucker Punch) from targeting grounded Pokémon. The power of Psychic type moves also increases while in effect. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Psychic Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.
Flavor Text: This protects Pokémon on the ground from priority moves and powers up Psychic-type moves for five turns.

Name: Psycho Boost
Description: Psycho Boost deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Psycho Cut
Description: Psycho Cut deals damage and uses critical dice
Flavor Text: The user tears at the target with blades formed by psychic power. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Psycho Shift
Description: Psycho Shift transfers any major status condition the user has (Poison, Burn, Paralysis, Sleep, Freeze) to the target, if the target does not already have a status condition. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.
Flavor Text: Using its psychic power of suggestion, the user transfers its status conditions to the target.

Name: Psyshock
Description: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
Flavor Text: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.

Name: Psystrike
Description: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
Flavor Text: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack the target. This attack does physical damage.

Name: Psywave
Description: Psywave inflicts a random amount of HP damage, determined by rolling a d20 for every 20 levels of the user (so 1d20 for level 1, 2d20 for level 20 and above, 3d20 for level 40 and above, etc.) The damage is typeless (not affected by type advantages/disadvantages) but it still does not hit Dark type Pokémon.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with an odd psychic wave. The attack varies in intensity.
Meta: this is nerfed a bit from the original

Name: Punishment
Description: Punishment deals varying damage based on the opponent's stat increases. It starts at base power 60 and increases by 20 for every net stat boost of the opponent, up to a maximum of 200 (7 boosts).
Flavor Text: The more the target has powered up with stat changes, the greater the move’s power.

Name: Purify
Description: The user heals the target's status condition. If a condition is restored, it also heals the user by 25% of their max HP
Range: Self or single ally Pokémon within 10m
Flavor Text: The user heals the target’s status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user’s own HP.
Meta: I assume this can target self

Name: Pursuit
Description: The user of Pursuit chases their target, moving a distance of up to 20m before making the attack (regardless of the user's speed). Pursuit takes the place of the regular move action for this turn, so you cannot use both Pursuit and normal movement within the same turn.
Flavor Text: The power of this attack move is doubled if it’s used on a target that’s switching out of battle.
Meta: Reinterpreted it as "you can use this move to pounce on Pokémon that are normally out of range", and removed damage bonus. Consider adding the bonus back based on distance to target?

Name: Pyro Ball
Description: Pyro Ball has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of burning the target.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by igniting a small stone and launching it as a fiery ball at the target. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Quash
Description: Quash reduces the priority of all of the target's Moves during their next turn. Moves with a priority above 0 go down to 0 and cannot be used proactively. Moves with priority 0 go down to -1. They can be initiated during the target's turn, but their effect does not happen until the beginning of their next turn. Moves in this category which already have an effect "at the beginning of the user's next turn" will get that effect immediately. Moves with a priority already below 0 are unaffected.
Flavor Text: The user suppresses the target and makes its move go last.
Meta: This one can have a lot of edge cases...

Name: Quick Attack
Description: Quick Attack deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
Flavor Text: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.

Name: Quick Guard
Description: Quick Guard protects nearby allies from all increased priority moves, until the beginning of the user's next turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves. The accuracy of Quick Guard does not decrease if used consecutively after itself or Wide Guard. However, it does decrease the accuracy of Protect, Detect, Endure, Spiky Shield, King's Shield and Baneful Bunker by one stage each time it or Wide Guard is used.
Range: Self and all ally Pokémon within 5m
Flavor Text: The user protects itself and its allies from priority moves.

Name: Quiver Dance
Description: Quiver Dance raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user lightly performs a beautiful, mystic dance. This boosts the user’s Sp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.

Name: Rage
Description: Rage deals damage, and every time the user is hit by a direct attack until they use a Move other than Rage, the user's Attack is raised by one stage (to the usual limit of +6). The Attack increases will continue as long as Rage is the last Move used, even if it misses, the user is incapacitated (paralyzed, sleeping, etc) or uses an item. The Attack increase activates for every blow of multi-hit moves such as Double Slap or Fury Swipes.
Flavor Text: As long as this move is in use, the power of rage raises the Attack stat each time the user is hit in battle.

Name: Rage Powder
Description: All enemies of the user are unable to target a Pokémon other than the user until the beginning of the user's next turn. They are not compelled to attack the user, but they cannot choose an alternative target either. Moves which target terrain, have an area of effect, or which already decided their target before Rage Powder was used are unaffected. This Move has higher priority than most other Moves.
Flavor Text: The user scatters a cloud of irritating powder to draw attention to itself. Opposing Pokémon aim only at the user.
Meta: copied from Follow Me. See also Spotlight

Name: Rain Dance
Description: Rain Dance causes a rain shower that lasts for 5 turns, and induces these additional effects: The power of Water-type moves increases by 50%. The power of Fire-type moves, Solar Beam and Solar Blade decreases by 50%. The moves Thunder and Hurricane ignore accuracy. The moves Synthesis, Morning Sun and Moonlight recover half of their regular amount. Pokémon with the ability Dry Skin and Rain Dish recover HP each turn. Pokémon with the ability Hydration will be cured of major status conditions. Pokémon with the ability Swift Swim double their speed.
Flavor Text: The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers the power of Fire-type moves.

Name: Rapid Spin
Description: Rapid Spin deals damage, raises the user's Speed by one stage, and removes the effects of moves which entrap the character. It fails if the move misses or the target is immune. The effects from the following Moves are removed: Bind, Clamp, Fire Spin, Infestation, Leech Seed, Magma Storm, Sand Tomb, Snap Trap, Sticky Web, Thunder Cage, Whirlpool, Wrap
Flavor Text: A spin attack that can also eliminate such moves as Bind, Wrap, and Leech Seed. This also raises the user’s Speed stat.

Name: Razor Leaf
Description: Razor Leaf deals damage and uses critical dice
Flavor Text: Sharp-edged leaves are launched to slash at opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Razor Shell
Description: Razor Shell deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user cuts its target with sharp shells. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Razor Wind
Description: The user of Razor Wind will whip up a whirlwind on the first turn. On the second turn, Razor Wind deals damage and uses critical dice. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Razor Wind executes in one turn. The target is fixed on the first turn.
Flavor Text: In this two-turn attack, blades of wind hit opposing Pokémon on the second turn. Critical hits land more easily.
Meta: easily dodged?

Name: Recover
Description: Recover restores up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
Flavor Text: Restoring its own cells, the user restores its own HP by half of its max HP.

Name: Recycle
Description: This Move restores the last consumable item held by the user which has since been used or destroyed. This Move only works if the user is not already holding a different item.
Flavor Text: The user recycles a held item that has been used in battle so it can be used again.

Name: Reflect
Description: Reflect creates a static spherical barrier around the user which reduces incoming damage from Physical attacks by 50%, for 5 turns. If the user is holding Light Clay when Reflect is used, its effects last for 8 turns. Attacks originating from within the bubble are unaffected. Pokémon can freely move in and out of the bubble. The move Brick Break, when used against a Pokémon behind the Reflect's effect, will remove the screen before dealing damage. The ability Infiltrator bypasses the effects of Reflect. Reflect is the Physical counterpart to Light Screen.
Flavor Text: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical attacks for five turns.

Name: Reflect Type
Description: Reflect Type changes the user's type to match the type(s) of the target.
Flavor Text: The user reflects the target’s type, making the user the same type as the target.

Name: Refresh
Description: Cures paralysis, poison, and burns on the user or an adjacent ally.
Range: Self or single adjacent ally Pokémon
Flavor Text: The user rests to cure itself of poisoning, a burn, or paralysis.
Meta: changed to be usable on allies

Name: Relic Song
Description: 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of putting the target to sleep. Targets with the Soundproof ability are unaffected.
Flavor Text: The user sings an ancient song and attacks by appealing to the hearts of the listening opposing Pokémon. This may also induce sleep.

Name: Rest
Description: The user restores their HP to maximum, then falls asleep for the next 2 turns (waking up at the end of the 2nd turn). This rest cannot be interrupted by normal means.
Flavor Text: The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully restores the user’s HP and heals any status conditions.
Meta: I think this is how the move works

Name: Retaliate
Description: If an ally fainted since the user's last turn, this attack's power is 150.
Flavor Text: The user gets revenge for a fainted ally. If an ally fainted in the previous turn, this move’s power is increased.

Name: Return
Description: The power of Return is higher when the user likes its trainer more. The base power varies between 1 (minimum Friendship) and 102 (maximum Friendship). The exact formula is: Power = Friendship ÷ 2.5 Pokémon Friendship (aka Happiness) is a value between 0 and 255 (more details). Return is the counterpart move to Frustration.
Flavor Text: This full-power attack grows more powerful the more the user likes its Trainer.
Meta: Friendship is illegal

Name: Revelation Dance
Description: Revelation Dance's Type depends on the style of Oricorio: Baile Style = Fire, Pom-Pom Style = Electric, Pa'u Style = Psychic, Sensu Style = Ghost
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target by dancing very hard. The user’s type determines the type of this move.

Name: Revenge
Description: This attack does not land until the beginning of the user's next turn. If the Move's target does damage to the user during that time, the Move's power is doubled.
Flavor Text: This attack move’s power is doubled if the user has been hurt by the opponent in the same turn.

Name: Reversal
Description: Reversal's base power is equal to 130 minus the user's current HP. In other words, the lower the user's HP, the higher the power.
Flavor Text: An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the less HP the user has.

Name: Rising Voltage
Description: The user attacks with electric voltage rising from the ground. This move’s power doubles when the target is on Electric Terrain.

Name: Roar
Description: Roar forces affected Pokémon to run away from the user, to their maximum move distance. Pokémon with the abilities Soundproof or Suction Cups or those rooted by Ingrain are not affected by Roar.
Flavor Text: The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.

Name: Roar of Time
Description: User must recharge next turn, losing their action and movement
Flavor Text: The user blasts the target with power that distorts even time. The user can’t move on the next turn.

Name: Rock Blast
Description: Rock Blast hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user hurls hard rocks at the target. Two to five rocks are launched in a row.

Name: Rock Climb
Description: Rock Climb deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target by smashing into it with incredible force. This may also confuse the target.

Name: Rock Polish
Description: Rock Polish raises the user's Speed by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user polishes its body to reduce drag. This sharply raises the Speed stat.

Name: Rock Slide
Description: Rock Slide deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: Large boulders are hurled at opposing Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also make the opposing Pokémon flinch.

Name: Rock Smash
Description: Rock Smash deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with a punch. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Rock Throw
Description: Rock Throw deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The user picks up and throws a small rock at the target to attack.

Name: Rock Tomb
Description: Rock Tomb deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Flavor Text: Boulders are hurled at the target. This also lowers the target’s Speed stat by preventing its movement.

Name: Rock Wrecker
Description: User must spend their next turn to recharge, losing their action and movement.
Flavor Text: The user launches a huge boulder at the target to attack. The user can’t move on the next turn.

Name: Role Play
Description: Role Play copies the opponent's ability, replacing its own with that of the target's until the end of the battle. Role Play does not work on Pokémon with Wonder Guard or Multitype
Flavor Text: The user mimics the target completely, copying the target’s Ability.

Name: Rolling Kick
Description: Rolling Kick deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user lashes out with a quick, spinning kick. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Rollout
Description: The user of Rollout attacks for 5 turns (including this one), doubling in power each turn. The user must declare and lock in the next target of Rollout at the end of each of their turns. The user loses their regular action and must move towards their intended target on each turn. The user cannot cancel the move on their own. However, if Rollout is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses, the user flinches, the user cannot attack due to paralysis, or no more targets are within range) then it will stop. If it doesn't miss, Rollout will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively. If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn this battle then Rollout doubles in power, i.e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively.
Flavor Text: The user continually rolls into the target over five turns. It becomes more powerful each time it hits.
Meta: Allowing target switching but giving each target a full turn to react so they can use Protect or whatever feels like a good way to balance this move

Name: Roost
Description: User recovers half of its max HP and loses the Flying type (and the ability to use the moves Fly and Sky Drop) for their next 3 turns.
Flavor Text: The user lands and rests its body. This move restores the user’s HP by up to half of its max HP.

Name: Rototiller
Description: Rototiller raises the Attack and Special Attack of any Grass-type Pokémon on the field by one stage each.
Flavor Text: Tilling the soil, the user makes it easier for plants to grow. This raises the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of Grass-type Pokémon.

Name: Round
Description: After any Pokémon on the field uses Round, any additional Pokémon within range who also know Round may follow up with it as though it were a priority attack, with increased base power of 120.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with a song. Others can join in the Round to increase the power of the attack.

Name: Sacred Fire
Description: Sacred Fire deals damage and has a 50% chance (a d20 rolls 11 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Sacred Fire can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.
Flavor Text: The target is razed with a mystical fire of great intensity. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Sacred Sword
Description: Sacred Sword deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case). Note this does not include the effects of screens like Reflect as they are different to regular stat boosts.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by slicing with a long horn. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage.

Name: Safeguard
Description: The user's party is protected from status conditions for 5 turns
Range: Self and all ally Pokémon within 10m
Flavor Text: The user creates a protective field that prevents status conditions for five turns.

Name: Sand Attack
Description: Sand Attack lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Although it is a Ground-type move it still affects raised Pokémon. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: Sand is hurled in the target’s face, reducing the target’s accuracy.

Name: Sand Tomb
Description: Sand Tomb inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user traps the target inside a harshly raging sandstorm for four to five turns.

Name: Sandstorm
Description: Sandstorm creates a sandstorm on the battlefield that lasts for 5 turns and induces these additional effects: All Pokémon take 2d6 damage at the end of each of their respective turns, except Ground, Rock and Steel types and those with the Magic Guard, Overcoat, Sand Force, Sand Rush or Sand Veil abilities. The Special Defense of Rock-type Pokémon is increased by 50%. The move Shore Up recovers additional HP. The power of Solar Beam and Solar Blade decreases by 50%. The moves Synthesis, Morning Sun and Moonlight recover 25% of the user's max HP (instead of the usual 50%). Pokémon with the ability Sand Force increase the power of Rock, Ground and Steel type moves by 30%. Pokémon with the ability Sand Rush double their speed. Pokémon with the ability Sand Veil increase their evasion by one stage.
Flavor Text: A five-turn sandstorm is summoned to hurt all combatants except Rock, Ground, and Steel types. It raises the Sp. Def stat of Rock types.

Name: Scald
Description: Scald deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Scald can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.
Flavor Text: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Scale Shot
Description: The user attacks by shooting scales 1d4 + 1 times in a row on this turn. See the rules for "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.Afterwards, this Move boosts the user’s Speed stat and lowers its Defense stat.

Name: Scary Face
Description: Scary Face lowers the target's Speed by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user frightens the target with a scary face to harshly lower its Speed stat.

Name: Scorching Sands
Description: The user throws scorching sand at the target to attack. This has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of burning the target.

Name: Scratch
Description: Scratch is one of the most common and basic moves a Pokémon learns. It deals damage with no additional effects.
Flavor Text: Hard, pointed, sharp claws rake the target to inflict damage.

Name: Screech
Description: Screech lowers the target's Defense by two stages.
Flavor Text: An earsplitting screech harshly lowers the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Searing Shot
Description: Searing Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The user torches everything around it in an inferno of scarlet flames. This may also leave those it hits with a burn.

Name: Secret Power
Description: Secret Power deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of inducing a secondary effect on the opponent, depending on the environment. Grass = sleep, Water = lowers attack by one stage, Snow = freeze, Deserts & Roads = lowers accuracy by 1 stage, Caves & Mountains = flinch, Buildings = paralysis
Flavor Text: The additional effects of this attack depend upon where it was used.

Name: Secret Sword
Description: This attack is contested by the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
Flavor Text: The user cuts with its long horn. The odd power contained in the horn does physical damage to the target.

Name: Seed Bomb
Description: Seed Bomb deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds down on the target from above.

Name: Seed Flare
Description: Seed Flare deals damage and has a 40% chance (a d20 rolls 13 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Defense by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user emits a shock wave from its body to attack its target. This may also harshly lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Seismic Toss
Description: The damage of Seismic Toss is equal to the user's level. So at level 100 the Pokémon will inflict 100 HP damage.
Flavor Text: The target is thrown using the power of gravity. It inflicts damage equal to the user’s level.

Name: Self-Destruct
Description: Self-Destruct causes the user to explode at the beginning of their next turn, dealing high damage, but causing the user to faint.
Flavor Text: The user attacks everything around it by causing an explosion. The user faints upon using this move.
Meta: Made this one distinct from Explosion by giving it delayed effect.

Name: Shadow Ball
Description: Shadow Ball deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

Name: Shadow Bone
Description: Shadow Bone has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) to lower opponent's Defense by one stage
Flavor Text: The user attacks by beating the target with a bone that contains a spirit. This may also lower the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Shadow Claw
Description: Shadow Claw deals damage and uses critical dice.
Flavor Text: The user slashes with a sharp claw made from shadows. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Shadow Force
Description: The user of Shadow Force will vanish instantly on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Shadow Force deals damage, the user moves adjacent to their target, and the turn ends. If the user is protected by a move such as Protect, Detect, Wide Guard, etc., that effect will be canceled before the damage is dealt. While disappeared, the Pokémon can only be hit by moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Shadow Force executes in one turn.
Flavor Text: The user disappears, then strikes the target on the next turn. This move hits even if the target protects itself.

Name: Shadow Punch
Description: Shadow Punch deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: The user throws a punch from the shadows. This attack never misses.

Name: Shadow Sneak
Description: Shadow Sneak deals damage and has a priority of +1.
Flavor Text: The user extends its shadow and attacks the target from behind. This move always goes first.

Name: Sharpen
Description: Sharpen raises the user's Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user makes its edges more jagged, which raises its Attack stat.

Name: Sheer Cold
Description: Sheer Cold has high power but its accuracy is very low.  This Move may not be used more than once in succession. If the user is not an Ice type, this Move's accuracy is 3.
Flavor Text: The target faints instantly. It’s less likely to hit the target if it’s used by Pokémon other than Ice types.
Meta: OHKO

Name: Shell Side Arm
Description: May poison opponent. Inflicts either Special or Physical damage, whichever is better.

Name: Shell Smash
Description: Shell Smash lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each, while also raising Attack, Special Attack and Speed by two stages each.
Flavor Text: The user breaks its shell, which lowers Defense and Sp. Def stats but sharply raises its Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats.

Name: Shell Trap
Description: Shell Trap sets a trap which lasts until the beginning of the user's next turn. If the user takes physical damage during that time, the attack triggers against the opponent who struck.
Flavor Text: The user sets a shell trap. If the user is hit by a physical move, the trap will explode and inflict damage on opposing Pokémon.

Name: Shift Gear
Description: Shift Gear raises the user's Attack by one stage and Speed by two stages.
Flavor Text: The user rotates its gears, raising its Attack stat and sharply raising its Speed stat.

Name: Shock Wave
Description: Shock Wave deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: The user strikes the target with a quick jolt of electricity. This attack never misses.

Name: Shore Up
Description: The user regains up to 50% of its max HP. During a sandstorm, this increases to 75%.
Flavor Text: The user regains up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP in a sandstorm.

Name: Signal Beam
Description: Signal Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user attacks with a sinister beam of light. This may also confuse the target.

Name: Silver Wind
Description: Silver Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with powdery scales blown by the wind. This may also raise all the user’s stats.

Name: Simple Beam
Description: Simple Beam changes the target's ability to Simple. It does not cancel any ability's effects already felt (such as the Attack drop from Intimidate), but it does stop any further effects the ability may have (for example, damage from Rough Skin). It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant or Multitype.
Flavor Text: The user’s mysterious psychic wave changes the target’s Ability to Simple.

Name: Sing
Description: Sing attempts to put all nearby Pokémon to sleep. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. Pokémon with the Soundproof ability are likewise unaffected.
Flavor Text: A soothing lullaby is sung in a calming voice that puts the target into a deep slumber.

Name: Sketch
Description: The user learns the Move last used by the target until the end of the battle. The user must meet the Move's minimum level requirement to use the Move. If Sketch is used multiple times, the new Move replaces the previously Sketched one.
Flavor Text: It enables the user to permanently learn the move last used by the target. Once used, Sketch disappears.
Meta: This would be useful out of battle

Name: Skill Swap
Description: The user swaps Abilities with the opponent.
Flavor Text: The user employs its psychic power to exchange Abilities with the target.

Name: Skitter Smack
Description: The user skitters behind the target to attack. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Skull Bash
Description: The user of Skull Bash will tuck in its head on the first turn and raise its Defense by one stage. On the second turn, Skull Bash selects a target and deals damage, consuming that turn's action. The user still retains normal movement on the 2nd turn. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Skull Bash executes in one turn.
Flavor Text: The user tucks in its head to raise its Defense stat on the first turn, then rams the target on the next turn.
Meta: For this and similar attacks, I want the user to be able to move and re-target on the second turn

Name: Sky Attack
Description: The user of Sky Attack will become cloaked in a harsh light on the first turn. On the second turn, Sky Attack selects a target, deals damage, and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. The action on the second turn is used for the attack, but regular movement is retained. This Move also uses critical dice. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Sky Attack executes in one turn. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits.
Range: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Flavor Text: A second-turn attack move where critical hits land more easily. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Sky Drop
Description: Sky Drop takes the target into the air on the first turn, then drops them on the second turn, wherein the target receives damage, both Pokémon move to a space within the user's move range, and the turn ends. While in the air, neither Pokémon can be hit, except by Gust, Hurricane, Sky Uppercut, Smack Down, Thunder or Twister. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit. Grabbed Pokémon lose movement on their turn but they may still use Moves on their attacker. Sky Drop will appear to work on Flying-types and those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis, but will not cause them any damage. It fails if Gravity is in effect, the target is holding an Iron Ball, or is behind a Substitute. If the move is interrupted (such as by the user Flinching) both Pokémon return to the ground and may suffer damage at the GM's discretion.
Flavor Text: The user takes the target into the sky, then drops it during the next turn. The target cannot attack while in the sky.
Meta: Changed so that the targeted Pokémon can still fight back in the air. Increased base power from 60 to 80 to balance this. Interrupting the attack also seems like it could have negative consequences, so I made that explicit in the description. Also changed to Agility attack.

Name: Sky Uppercut
Description: Hits the opponent, even during Fly.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with an uppercut thrown skyward with force.

Name: Slack Off
Description: Slack Off recovers 50% of the user's maximum HP.
Flavor Text: The user slacks off, restoring its own HP by up to half of its max HP.

Name: Slam
Description: The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the like to inflict damage.
Flavor Text: The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the like to inflict damage.

Name: Slash
Description: Slash deals damage and uses critical dice.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with a slash of claws or blades. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Sleep Powder
Description: Sleep Powder puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
Flavor Text: The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust around the target.

Name: Sleep Talk
Description: The user performs one of its own moves while sleeping. The Move used is decided by a random dice roll. If the user is not asleep, or the selected Move is not possible in the current context, nothing happens.
Flavor Text: While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the moves it knows.

Name: Sludge
Description: Sludge deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.

Name: Sludge Bomb
Description: Sludge Bomb deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.

Name: Sludge Wave
Description: Sludge Wave deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Range: All Pokémon in a 90 degree cone extending forwards 10m
Flavor Text: The user strikes everything around it by swamping the area with a giant sludge wave. This may also poison those hit.

Name: Smack Down
Description: Smack Down deals damage and knocks the target to the ground, inflicting the Grounded status. Any raised Pokémon now become susceptible to Ground moves and Arena Trap. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Smack Down can hit Pokémon using Fly or Bounce and will bring them back down to the ground, thus cancelling the moves. It can also hit Pokémon using Sky Drop but does not knock them to the ground. It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal.
Flavor Text: The user throws a stone or similar projectile to attack the target. A flying Pokémon will fall to the ground when it’s hit.

Name: Smart Strike
Description: The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses.
Flavor Text: The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses.

Name: Smelling Salts
Description: Smelling Salts deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the target is paralyzed. However, it also cures the paralysis.
Flavor Text: This attack’s power is doubled when used on a target with paralysis. This also cures the target’s paralysis, however.

Name: Smog
Description: Smog deals damage and has a 40% chance (a d20 rolls 13 or higher) of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Flavor Text: The target is attacked with a discharge of filthy gases. This may also poison the target.

Name: Smokescreen
Description: Smokescreen lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Flavor Text: The user releases an obscuring cloud of smoke or ink. This lowers the target’s accuracy.

Name: Snap Trap
Description: Snap Trap inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user snares the target in a snap trap for four to five turns.

Name: Snarl
Description: Snarl deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user yells as if it’s ranting about something, which lowers the Sp. Atk stats of opposing Pokémon.

Name: Snatch
Description: Snatch is a priority move which can explicity be used as a reaction during the middle of another player's turn, and which steals the effects of the currently in-progress (if used as an reaction) or simply the next status move used by any opponent(s) until the user's next turn. If two or more Pokémon use Snatch, the slowest of the Pokémon will gain the effect, because the fastest Pokémon will steal the move first, then the next slowest will steal the move from the snatcher and so on. Moves that can be snatched: - Stat boosts, for example Swords Dance or Belly Drum (exceptions below) - Protection moves, for example Substitute, Lucky Chant, Wide Guard or Quick Guard (exceptions below) - Recovery and healing moves, for example Recover, Ingrain or Heal Bell - Imprison - Other self-induced effects such as Magnet Rise, Power Trick or Light Screen. Moves that cannot be snatched: Acupressure, Curse, Protect or Detect, Helping Hand, Taunt.
Flavor Text: The user steals the effects of any attempts to use a healing or stat-changing move.
Meta: This is a really tricky one to balance because of the "rock paper scissors under the table" that the video games had. If you have to declare you are using Snatch in advance, no one will want to heal (I suppose it's a discouragement tactic). However, if you can't interrupt other players' heals, then Snatch loses its use. This implementation favors the attacker more, but is balanced somewhat by them losing their action afterwards.

Name: Snipe Shot
Description: Ignores Moves and abilities that restrict targeting such as Spotlight. This Move uses critical dice
Flavor Text: The user ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon’s moves and Abilities that draw in moves, allowing this move to hit the chosen target.

Name: Snore
Description: Snore deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. However, it can only be used while the user is asleep (either from a move like Hypnosis or self-induced via Rest). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: This attack can be used only if the user is asleep. The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.

Name: Soak
Description: Soak changes the target's type to Water. It does not work on Pokémon with the ability Multitype.
Flavor Text: The user shoots a torrent of water at the target and changes the target’s type to Water.

Name: Soft-Boiled
Description: Soft-Boiled recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
Flavor Text: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP.

Name: Solar Beam
Description: The user of Solar Beam will absorb light on the first turn. On the second turn, Solar Beam selects a target and deals damage, which uses that turn's action (but not movement). During intense sunlight or when holding a Power Herb, Solar Beam executes in one turn. During rain, hail or a sandstorm its base power decreases by 50%.
Flavor Text: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.
Meta: Since turn order makes this move easily dodged, changed the targeting rules so that it can be aimed on the 2nd turn.

Name: Solar Blade
Description: The user of Solar Blade will absorb light on the first turn. On the second turn, the user selects a target and deals damage. Regular movement is retained on the 2nd turn. During intense sunlight or when holding a Power Herb, Solar Blade executes in one turn. During rain, hail or a sandstorm its power decreases by 50%.
Flavor Text: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light and fills a blade with the light’s energy, attacking the target on the next turn.

Name: Sonic Boom
Description: Sonic Boom always deals 20 HP damage to the target, regardless of typing (although Ghost type Pokémon are still immune). It has no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is hit with a destructive shock wave that always inflicts 20 HP damage.

Name: Spacial Rend
Description: Spacial Rend deals damage and uses critical dice.
Flavor Text: The user tears the target along with the space around it. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Spark
Description: Spark deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The user throws an electrically charged tackle at the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Sparkling Aria
Description: All targets are cured of burns on hit, if they were afflicted by a burn
Flavor Text: The user bursts into song, emitting many bubbles. Any Pokémon suffering from a burn will be healed by the touch of these bubbles.

Name: Spectral Thief
Description: The user hides in the target's shadow, steals the target's stat boosts, and then attacks.
Flavor Text: The user hides in the target’s shadow, steals the target’s stat boosts, and then attacks.

Name: Speed Swap
Description: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target until the end of the battle
Flavor Text: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.

Name: Spider Web
Description: Opponent cannot move normally until they succeed in resolving the Webbed Status effect.
Flavor Text: The user ensnares the target with thin, gooey silk so it can’t flee from battle.
Meta: Reinterpreted "cannot flee" to "loses movement". Has the same implementation as Mean Look

Name: Spike Cannon
Description: Spike Cannon hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.

Name: Spikes
Description: Spikes lays a trap of spikes on the ground, which inflict 3d6 damage on any Pokémon which cross over them. The spikes will not hit raised Pokémon. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Spikes can be cleared from the field using Defog or by a Flying-type move being used directly on them.
Flavor Text: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing team’s feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch into battle.

Name: Spiky Shield
Description: Spiky Shield prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, until the beginning of the user's next turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Spiky Shield user on that turn, the attacker receives 4d6 damage. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. Contact damage does not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities. The accuracy of Spiky Shield drops one stage each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker.
Flavor Text: In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also damages any attacker that makes direct contact.
Meta: is 4d6 damage too high?

Name: Spirit Break
Description: Spirit Break deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with so much force that it could break the target’s spirit. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Spirit Shackle
Description: Spirit Shackle deals damage and prevents the target from moving normally for their next 2 turns.
Flavor Text: The user attacks while simultaneously stitching the target’s shadow to the ground to prevent the target from escaping.
Meta: can other effects like telekinesis still move the victim?

Name: Spit Up
Description: Spit Up deals varying damage depending on how many times the user used Stockpile. The base power is 100, 200 or 300 if the user stockpiled one, two or three times respectively. Spit Up also removes the Defense and Special Defense boosts given through Stockpile.
Flavor Text: The power stored using the move Stockpile is released at once in an attack. The more power is stored, the greater the move’s power.

Name: Spite
Description: The last Move used by the target is disabled for their next 1d4 turns
Flavor Text: The user unleashes its grudge on the move last used by the target by cutting 4 PP from it.
Meta: changed to be the same as Disable

Name: Splash
Description: Doesn't do anything.
Flavor Text: The user just flops and splashes around to no effect at all...

Name: Spore
Description: Spore puts the target to sleep. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
Flavor Text: The user scatters bursts of spores that induce sleep.

Name: Spotlight
Description: The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target may be attacked for this turn. All enemies of the target are unable to use Moves on a Pokémon other than the target until the beginning of the user's next turn. They are not compelled to attack the target, but they cannot choose an alternative target either. Moves which target terrain, have an area of effect, or which already decided their target before Spotlight was used are unaffected. This Move has higher priority than most other Moves.
Flavor Text: The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target will be attacked during the turn.
Meta: Originally I believe Spotlight redirected existing attacks, but that seems unbalanced?

Name: Stealth Rock
Description: Stealth Rock lays a trap of sharp levitating rocks, which inflict 3d6 damage on any Pokémon which attempt to pass through them. The rocks can be cleared from the field using Defog.
Flavor Text: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the opposing team. The trap hurts opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
Meta: Changed it to be a wall of fire. Is 3d6 damage right?

Name: Steam Eruption
Description: Steam Eruption deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The user immerses the target in superheated steam. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Name: Steamroller
Description: Steamroller deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. If the target has used Minimize, Steamroller ignores accuracy and deals double damage.
Flavor Text: The user crushes its target by rolling over the target with its rolled-up body. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Steel Beam
Description: Steel Beam deals damage but the user loses 50% of its HP.
Flavor Text: The user fires a beam of steel that it collected from its entire body. This also damages the user.

Name: Steel Roller
Description: The user attacks while destroying the terrain. This move fails if a terrain-affecting Move has not been used.

Name: Steel Wing
Description: Steel Wing deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of raising the user's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The target is hit with wings of steel. This may also raise the user’s Defense stat.

Name: Sticky Web
Description: Sticky Web sets up a sticky net on the terrain, which lowers the Speed of Pokémon who touch it by two stages. Raised Pokémon are not affected. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis.
Flavor Text: The user weaves a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers their Speed stats upon switching into battle.

Name: Stockpile
Description: Stockpile raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each and charges up power for use with companion moves Spit Up or Swallow. Stockpile can be used up to three times before its companion moves, which will attack or recover HP respectively. The power of Spit Up and HP gained from Swallow varies depending on how many times Stockpile was used. After one of those moves is used, the user loses the Defense and Special Defense boosts.
Flavor Text: The user charges up power and raises both its Defense and Sp. Def stats. The move can be used three times.

Name: Stomp
Description: Stomp deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. If the target has used Minimize, Stomp ignores accuracy and deals double damage.
Flavor Text: The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Stomping Tantrum
Description: Driven by frustration, the user attacks the target. If the user's previous move has failed, the power of this move doubles.
Flavor Text: Driven by frustration, the user attacks the target. If the user’s previous move has failed, the power of this move doubles.

Name: Stone Edge
Description: Stone Edge deals damage and uses critical dice.
Flavor Text: The user stabs the target from below with sharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.

Name: Stored Power
Description: Stored Power deals varying damage based on the user's stat increases. It starts at base power 20 and increases by 20 for each net stat boost the user has received, including Evasion and Accuracy. In other words the power is: (20 × NumIncreases) + 20
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with stored power. The more the user’s stats are raised, the greater the move’s power.

Name: Storm Throw
Description: When targeting Pokémon who are immune to critical hits, such as with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effect of Lucky Chant, Storm Throw will have its base power reduced to 60.
Flavor Text: The user strikes the target with a fierce blow. This attack always results in a critical hit.

Name: Strange Steam
Description: Has a 20% chance (a d20 rolling 17 or higher) of confusing the opponent.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target by emitting steam. This may also confuse the target.

Name: Strength
Description: Strength deals damage with no additional effect in battle.
Flavor Text: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power.

Name: Strength Sap
Description: Roll d6 equal to the target's number of Attack dice, and recover that much HP. This Move then lowers the target's Attack stat by one stage. (100% chance)
Flavor Text: The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target’s Attack stat. It also lowers the target’s Attack stat.

Name: String Shot
Description: String Shot lowers the target's Speed by two stages.
Flavor Text: Opposing Pokémon are bound with silk blown from the user’s mouth that harshly lowers the Speed stat.

Name: Struggle Bug
Description: Struggle Bug deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: While resisting, the user attacks opposing Pokémon. This lowers the Sp. Atk stats of those hit.

Name: Stuff Cheeks
Description: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat by 2 stages. This Move has no effect if the user is not holding a berry.
Flavor Text: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat.

Name: Stun Spore
Description: Stun Spore paralyzes the target, if it hits. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that paralyzes the target.

Name: Submission
Description: Submission deals damage, but the user receives 25% of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.
Flavor Text: The user grabs the target and recklessly dives for the ground. This also damages the user a little.

Name: Substitute
Description: The user sacrifices at least 20% of their current HP to create a decoy that takes damage for attacks in the user's place. The substitute's HP is equal to the amount sacrificed, and cannot be restored using healing or similar effects. The user may choose to spend more than the minimum amount of HP to make the substitute stronger.
Flavor Text: The user creates a substitute for itself using some of its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
Meta: It's more interesting if they have the option of pouring more HP into the substitute

Name: Sucker Punch
Description: Sucker Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1. However, the Move only works if the target is preparing a delayed attack such as Solar Beam or in the middle of a multi-turn attack such as Rage.
Flavor Text: This move enables the user to attack first. This move fails if the target is not readying an attack.
Meta: reinterpreted the effect and increased power slightly

Name: Sunny Day
Description: Sunny Day causes bright sunlight that lasts for 5 turns, and induces additional effects. The power of Fire-type moves increases by 50%. The power of Water-type moves decreases by 50%. The accuracy of Thunder and Hurricane lowers by 50%. Solar Beam and Solar Blade do not require the charging turn and attack straight away. Growth raises the user's Attack and Special Attack two stages each. The moves Synthesis and Morning Sun recover additional HP. Pokémon with the ability Chlorophyll double their speed. Pokémon with the ability Dry Skin take 2d6 damage at the end of each of their turns. Pokémon with the ability Leaf Guard cannot be afflicted by major status conditions (though existing conditions remain). The Special Attack of Pokémon with the ability Solar Power increases by 50%. Cherrim changes into Sunshine Form and its ability Flower Gift increases Attack and Special Defense. Castform changes to Sunny Form. Pokémon cannot be frozen. This Move cannot be used during nighttime.
Flavor Text: The user intensifies the sun for five turns, powering up Fire-type moves. It lowers the power of Water-type moves.
Meta: So many side effects.... Also added "can't use this in the middle of the night" clause.

Name: Sunsteel Strike
Description: This Move ignores the target's ability.
Flavor Text: The user slams into the target with the force of a meteor. This move can be used on the target regardless of its Abilities.

Name: Super Fang
Description: Always takes off half of the opponent's current HP.
Flavor Text: The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This cuts the target’s HP in half.

Name: Superpower
Description: Superpower deals damage but lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each after attacking.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with great power. However, this also lowers the user’s Attack and Defense stats.

Name: Supersonic
Description: Supersonic causes the target to become confused. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. Soundproof also prevents this move.
Flavor Text: The user generates odd sound waves from its body that confuse the target.

Name: Surf
Description: If the opponent is hidden underwater from using Dive, Surf will hit with double power.
Range: All Pokémon within a 5m x 10m area (does not have to originate from the user)
Flavor Text: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.
Meta: changed to an arbitrary line AOE

Name: Surging Strikes
Description: This move strikes 3 times. It always uses critical dice and ignores stat changes on the target

Name: Swagger
Description: Swagger confuses the target but raises their Attack by two stages. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user enrages and confuses the target. However, this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.

Name: Swallow
Description: Swallow recovers a varying amount of HP depending on how many times the user has used Stockpile. It recovers 25%, 50% or 100% of the user's maximum HP if the user stockpiled one, two or three times respectively. Swallow also removes the Defense and Special Defense boosts given through Stockpile.
Flavor Text: The power stored using the move Stockpile is absorbed by the user to heal its HP. Storing more power heals more HP.

Name: Sweet Kiss
Description: Sweet Kiss causes the target to become confused. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user kisses the target with a sweet, angelic cuteness that causes confusion.

Name: Sweet Scent
Description: Sweet Scent lowers the target's Evasion by one stage.
Flavor Text: A sweet scent that harshly lowers opposing Pokémon’s evasiveness.

Name: Swift
Description: Swift deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.

Name: Switcheroo
Description: Switcheroo switches held items with the target. It does not require both Pokémon to be holding an item, in which case the item is simply given to the target or received from it. Pokémon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
Flavor Text: The user trades held items with the target faster than the eye can follow.

Name: Swords Dance
Description: Swords Dance raises the user's Attack by two stages.
Flavor Text: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.

Name: Synchronoise
Description: Synchronoise hits all adjacent Pokémon that share a type with the user. Dual type Pokémon match either of their types, so for example a Normal/Flying Pokémon using Synchronoise will hit a Flying/Dragon type.
Range: All Pokémon within 10m which match type
Flavor Text: Using an odd shock wave, the user inflicts damage on any Pokémon of the same type in the area around it.

Name: Synthesis
Description: The user recovers 50% of their maximum HP. If Sunny Day is active, this increases to 75%. If Rain, Hail, or Sandstorm is in effect, this decreases to 25%.
Flavor Text: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.

Name: Tackle
Description: Tackle is one of the most common and basic moves a Pokémon learns. It deals damage with no additional effects.
Flavor Text: A physical attack in which the user charges and slams into the target with its whole body.

Name: Tail Glow
Description: Tail Glow raises the user's Special Attack by three stages.
Flavor Text: The user stares at flashing lights to focus its mind, drastically raising its Sp. Atk stat.

Name: Tail Slap
Description: Tail Slap hits 1d4+1 times per turn used. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user attacks by striking the target with its hard tail. It hits the target two to five times in a row.

Name: Tail Whip
Description: Tail Whip lowers the target's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stats.

Name: Tailwind
Description: Tailwind doubles the speed of all allied Pokémon for 4 turns.
Range: Self and all ally Pokémon within 20m
Flavor Text: The user whips up a turbulent whirlwind that ups the Speed stats of the user and its allies for four turns.

Name: Take Down
Description: Take Down deals damage, but the user receives 25% of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.
Flavor Text: A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into the target. This also damages the user a little.

Name: Tar Shot
Description: Lowers the opponent's Speed by one stage. It also reduces their defense against Fire-type moves by 2 stages. This is treated as a stat decrease but is not tied to any particular stat. The condition can be removed by using a Water-type move on the affected Pokémon.
Flavor Text: The user pours sticky tar over the target, lowering the target’s Speed stat. The target becomes weaker to Fire-type moves.
Meta: Added the ability to use water moves to undo the debuff

Name: Taunt
Description: Taunt prevents the target from using Status-category moves for three turns.
Flavor Text: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use only attack moves for three turns.

Name: Tearful Look
Description: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk stats. (100% chance)
Flavor Text: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target’s Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

Name: Teatime
Description: Forces all Pokémon on the field to eat a berry from their inventory, if they have one. Pokémon who are holding a berry must eat that one. Otherwise, Pokémon with one or more berries in their inventory must choose one.
Flavor Text: The user has teatime with all the Pokémon in the battle. Each Pokémon eats its held Berry.
Meta: Allowed this to use inventory Berries and not just held ones. This is just a really silly move and I want it to see more use.

Name: Techno Blast
Description: Techno Blast deals damage. Its type changes depending on the held Drive: Normal type if no Drive is held. Fire type if Burn Drive is held. Ice type if Chill Drive is held. Water type if Douse Drive is held. Electric type if Shock Drive is held. Techno Blast is the signature move of Genesect.
Range: 1m x 20m line originating from the user
Flavor Text: The user fires a beam of light at its target. The move’s type changes depending on the Drive the user holds.
Meta: Changed to AOE beam

Name: Teeter Dance
Description: Teeter Dance causes all adjacent Pokémon to become confused. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user performs a wobbly dance that confuses the Pokémon around it.

Name: Telekinesis
Description: Telekinesis raises the target into the air their next three turns, guaranteeing that all attacks against the target will hit, regardless of Accuracy or Evasion. The target loses normal movement, and instead the user can spend their action to move the target up to 20m on their turn. The target gains the usual benefits of being raised, e.g. immunity to Ground-type moves. The effect is cancelled if the raised Pokémon is hit by Smack Down, or if the user is made to Flinch or uses a different Move. Telekinesis can also be used out-of-battle to move objects remotely, in which case it is treated as an area of effect which can target either a single large object or multiple small objects (at GM's discretion).
Flavor Text: The user makes the target float with its psychic power. The target is easier to hit for three turns.
Meta: Clarified movement rules to allow the user to move their target around, and added guidance for out-of-battle use.

Name: Teleport
Description: At the beginning of their next turn, the user teleports to any space they can clearly visualize. Teleport can be used to escape from trapping or grabbing moves such as Wrap, Block, and Sky Drop. Only the user and their held items may Teleport. Teleport may be used out of battle to access hard-to-reach areas that the user has clearly seen before.
Meta: Made this move more useful by allowing it to escape binds and traps, and adding guidance for out-of-battle use.

Name: Terrain Pulse
Description: The user utilizes the power of the terrain to attack. This move’s type is determined by the terrain its user is standing on.
Meta: The terrain-specific rules are kind of left to the imagination...

Name: Thief
Description: Thief deals damage and steals the target's held item, if the user is not holding an item. If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen. Pokémon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
Flavor Text: The user attacks and steals the target’s held item simultaneously. The user can’t steal anything if it already holds an item.
Meta: Change this so it can steal a random object from target inventory if there is no held item?

Name: Thousand Arrows
Description: Thousand Arrows deals damage and knocks the target(s) to the ground. Any raised Pokémon now become susceptible to Ground moves and Arena Trap. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Thousand Arrows can hit Pokémon using Fly or Bounce and will bring them back down to the ground, thus cancelling the moves. It can also hit Pokémon using Sky Drop but does not knock them to the ground. It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal.
Flavor Text: This move also hits opposing Pokémon that are in the air. Those Pokémon are knocked down to the ground.

Name: Thousand Waves
Description: Thousand Waves deals damage and prevents the target(s) from moving normally until they resolve the Stunned status effect
Flavor Text: The user attacks with a wave that crawls along the ground. Those it hits can’t flee from battle.

Name: Thrash
Description: The user of Thrash attacks for 3 turns (including this one), during which it loses its regular action (but not movement), and then becomes confused. A new target may be chosen for each attack. The user cannot cancel the move on their own. However, if Thrash is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses, the user flinches, the user cannot attack due to paralysis, or no more targets are within range) then it will stop and not cause confusion. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.

Name: Throat Chop
Description: Throat Chop deals damage and prevents the target from using sound-based moves such as Hyper Voice for their next two turns.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target’s throat, and the resultant suffering prevents the target from using moves that emit sound for two turns.

Name: Thunder
Description: Thunder deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If used during rain, Thunder ignores accuracy. Conversely, if used during intense sunlight, its accuracy drops to 10. Thunder can hit Pokémon during the first stage of Bounce, Fly or Sky Drop.
Flavor Text: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Thunder Cage
Description: Thunder Cage inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: The user traps the target in a cage of sparking electricity for four to five turns.

Name: Thunder Fang
Description: Thunder Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of paralyzing the target, and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user bites with electrified fangs. This may also make the target flinch or leave it with paralysis.

Name: Thunder Punch
Description: Thunder Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The target is punched with an electrified fist. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Thunder Shock
Description: Thunder Shock deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: A jolt of electricity crashes down on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Thunder Wave
Description: Thunder Wave paralyzes the opponent. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.

Name: Thunderbolt
Description: Thunderbolt deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Thunderous Kick
Description: Lowers opponent's Defense. (100% chance)
Flavor Text: The user overwhelms the target with lightning-like movement before delivering a kick. This also lowers the target’s Defense stat.

Name: Tickle
Description: Tickle lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user tickles the target into laughing, reducing its Attack and Defense stats.

Name: Topsy-Turvy
Description: Topsy-Turvy reverses the stat changes of the target Pokémon. For example, if the target has boosted their attack by 2 stages using Swords Dance, Topsy-Turvy will reduce their Attack down to -2 stages. Similarly, if the opponent has used Draco Meteor (lowering their Special Attack), Topsy-Turvy will raise their Special Attack to +2 stages.
Flavor Text: All stat changes affecting the target turn topsy-turvy and become the opposite of what they were.

Name: Torment
Description: The target cannot use the same move twice in a row until they resolve the Tormented status effect. The check for naturally resolving this effect is a d20 rolling 17 or higher, instead of the normal DC of 15.
Flavor Text: The user torments and enrages the target, making it incapable of using the same move twice in a row.
Meta: Changed to be a regular status effect except with a higher DC

Name: Toxic
Description: Toxic inflicts damage and causes the target to be badly poisoned. Pokémon that are badly poisoned will lose an increasing amount of HP at the end of each turn. The affected Pokémon will take 2d6 poison damage at the end of the first turn, which then increases by 2d6 each turn. In other words, the damage is 2d6, 4d6, 6d6, and so on. Toxic doesn't affect Pokémon already affected by a major status ailment, Pokémon behind a Substitute nor Poison- or Steel-type Pokémon.
Flavor Text: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.
Meta: Is this balanced? With poison-curing items it should be fine, but otherwise it's almost certain death

Name: Toxic Spikes
Description: Toxic Spikes lays a trap of poisonous spikes on the ground, which poison Pokémon which cross over them. The spikes will not poison any raised Pokémon, nor does it affect Poison or Steel types, nor Pokémon with the abilities Immunity or Magic Guard. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Toxic Spikes can be cleared from the field using Defog or by a Flying-type move being used directly on them. Poison type Pokémon (that are not raised) will also absorb the spikes, removing them from the field.
Flavor Text: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of the opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing Pokémon that switch into battle.
Meta: changed to AOE terrain trap

Name: Toxic Thread
Description: Inflicts the Poison status and lowers target's Speed by one stage. (100% chance)
Flavor Text: The user shoots poisonous threads to poison the target and lower the target’s Speed stat.

Name: Transform
Description: The user takes on the appearance, Ability, Type, and Moves of another nearby Pokémon. Stats, Level, HP, and buffs / debuffs remain unchanged. The level requirement of transformed Moves is enforced when attempting to use them. The transformation lasts for as long as the user wishes, or until they are Fainted.
Flavor Text: The user transforms into a copy of the target right down to having the same move set.
Meta: This one seems potentially overpowered but could also have a lot of interesting narrative use so I want to make it viable. Enforcing the move level requirement nerfs it a bit (so you can't just Transform into the boss and then use their uber moves).

Name: Tri Attack
Description: Tri Attack deals damage and has a 20% chance of paralyzing, burning or freezing the target. Roll a d20 and apply a status effect if it is 17 or higher. Roll a d4 to determine the effect: 1 = Paralyze, 2 = Burn, 3 = Freeze, 4 = Any one of your choice. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.
Flavor Text: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. This may also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.

Name: Trick
Description: Trick switches held items with the target. It does not require both Pokémon to be holding an item, in which case the item is simply given to the target or received from it. Pokémon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
Flavor Text: The user catches the target off guard and swaps its held item with its own.

Name: Trick Room
Description: The turn order for the battle is instantly reversed. Combatants which enter the battle after Trick Room is used will be inserted into the order as usual.
Flavor Text: The user creates a bizarre area in which slower Pokémon get to move first for five turns.
Meta: This one is kind of meta but I like it. It could mess with everyone's brains trying to figure out "how many turns have passed" for things like weather effects and recharges though...

Name: Trick-or-Treat
Description: Trick-or-Treat adds the Ghost type to the target. If the target is dual-typed they essentially become a triple-typed Pokémon. It fails if one of the Pokémon's types is already Ghost. If the target is under the effect of Forest's Curse the Grass type is replaced by Ghost.
Flavor Text: The user takes the target trick-or-treating. This adds Ghost type to the target’s type.

Name: Triple Axel
Description: Triple Axel deals damage and will strike three times, with each kick's base power increasing by 20. In other words the blows will be base power 20, 40 and 60 - a total of 120. Each hit has its own accuracy check, and if one kick misses, the move ends. See the rules for "Multi-Hit Moves" for more details.

Name: Triple Kick
Description: Triple Kick deals damage and will strike three times, with each kick's base power increasing by 10. In other words the blows will be base power 10, 20 and 30 - a total of 60. Each hit has its own accuracy check, and if one kick misses, the move ends. See the rules for "Multi-Hit Moves" for more details.
Flavor Text: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successful hit.

Name: Trop Kick
Description: Trop Kick deals damage and lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user lands an intense kick of tropical origins on the target. This also lowers the target’s Attack stat.

Name: Trump Card
Description: The user of this move chooses its power on each use. Accuracy decreases inversely to power level. The base power and accuracy start at 20/20. For every +20 increase in power, the accuracy decreases by 3. So you can choose 20/20, 40/17, 60/14, 80/11, 100/8, 120/5, or 140/2.
Flavor Text: The fewer PP this move has, the greater its power.
Meta: Switched to a gambling mechanic for high risk - high reward

Name: Twineedle
Description: Twineedle deals damage and will strike twice (with 25 base power each time). It has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of poisoning the target on each hit. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. See rules on "Multi-Hit Moves" for more details.
Flavor Text: The user damages the target twice in succession by jabbing it with two spikes. This may also poison the target.

Name: Twister
