Description: Twister deals damage and has a 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. Twister can hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stages of Bounce, Fly and Sky Drop - and in the case of Bounce and Fly, inflicts double damage.
Flavor Text: The user whips up a vicious tornado to tear at opposing Pokémon. This may also make them flinch.
Meta: changed to AOE

Name: U-turn
Description: After making its attack, the user swaps places with an ally Pokémon within movement range
Flavor Text: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
Meta: copied from Flip Turn / Volt Switch

Name: Uproar
Description: For this and the user's next 2 turns, they inflict damage on a single adjacent target. The user must declare and lock in their next target at the end of each turn. Regular movement is allowed during these turns. If no targets are available, the Move still continues but deals no damage. During this time, no Pokémon on the field will be able to sleep, and any sleeping Pokémon will be woken up. Once started, the user cannot cancel the attack on their own.
Flavor Text: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns. During that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.
Meta: Nerfed a bit (similar to Rollout) by forcing the next target to be declared in advance so they can react to it.

Name: V-create
Description: V-create deals damage but lowers the user's Defense, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each after attacking.
Flavor Text: With a hot flame on its forehead, the user hurls itself at its target. This lowers the user’s Defense, Sp. Def, and Speed stats.

Name: Vacuum Wave
Description: Vacuum Wave deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
Flavor Text: The user whirls its fists to send a wave of pure vacuum at the target. This move always goes first.

Name: Venom Drench
Description: If the target is poisoned, Venom Drench lowers its Attack, Special Attack and Speed by one stage each.
Flavor Text: Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd poisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack, Sp. Atk, and Speed stats of a poisoned target.

Name: Venoshock
Description: Inflicts double damage if the target is poisoned.
Flavor Text: The user drenches the target in a special poisonous liquid. This move’s power is doubled if the target is poisoned.

Name: Vine Whip
Description: Vine Whip deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is struck with slender, whiplike vines to inflict damage.

Name: Vise Grip
Description: Vise Grip deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.

Name: Vital Throw
Description: Vital Throw grabs an opponent and deals damage at the beginning of the attacker's next turn. Vital Throw ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it cannot target Pokémon who are Rooted or during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. Pokémon who are grabbed lose their movement on their turn and cannot initiate the Moves listed above, but they may use other Moves.
Flavor Text: The user attacks last. In return, this throw move never misses.
Meta: It feels like this one may have more edge cases.

Name: Volt Switch
Description: After making its attack, the user swaps places with an ally Pokémon within movement range
Flavor Text: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
Meta: copied from Flip Turn / U-Turn

Name: Volt Tackle
Description: Volt Tackle deals damage and has a 10% chance (a d20 rolls 19 or higher) of paralyzing the target, but the user receives one third of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
Flavor Text: The user electrifies itself and charges the target. This also damages the user quite a lot. This attack may leave the target with paralysis.

Name: Wake-Up Slap
Description: Wake-Up Slap deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the target is asleep. However, it also wakes up the target.
Flavor Text: This attack inflicts big damage on a sleeping target. This also wakes the target up, however.

Name: Water Gun
Description: Water Gun deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.

Name: Water Pledge
Description: Water Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Grass Pledge or Fire Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear. The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting. If Water Pledge is used with Grass Pledge, the move animation shows Grass Pledge and a swamp envelops the foe's team that halves the opponents' speed for 4 turns. If Water Pledge is used with Fire Pledge, the move animation shows Water Pledge and a rainbow appears in the sky on your team's side that doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring for 4 turns.
Flavor Text: A column of water hits the target. When used with its fire equivalent, its power increases and a rainbow appears.

Name: Water Pulse
Description: Water Pulse deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Flavor Text: The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of water. This may also confuse the target.

Name: Water Shuriken
Description: Water Shuriken hits 1d4 + 1 times and attacks with increased priority. See rules for "Multi-Hit Moves" for more details.
Flavor Text: The user hits the target with throwing stars two to five times in a row. This move always goes first.

Name: Water Sport
Description: The user soaks the battlefield with water. Water Sport reduces the power of Fire-type moves by 50%. The effect applies to the entire field. Most Pokémon that learn Water Sport are part Water type and thus already resistant to Fire attacks.
Flavor Text: This weakens Fire-type moves for five turns.

Name: Water Spout
Description: Water Spout has a base power equal to the user's current HP, to a maximum of 150. Water Spout is a counterpart move to Eruption. It is also similar to Crush Grip and Wring Out, based on the user rather than the opponent.
Flavor Text: The user spouts water to damage opposing Pokémon. The lower the user’s HP, the lower the move’s power.
Meta: changed to indiscriminate AOE similar to Eruption

Name: Waterfall
Description: Waterfall deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch.

Name: Weather Ball
Description: The power and type of Weather Ball changes with the weather. With no weather condition it is Normal and has a base power of 50. If a weather condition is in effect, its power increases to 100 and the move becomes a different type: Bright sunlight = Fire type, Heavy rain = Water type, Sandstorm = Rock type, Hailstorm = Ice type, Fog = stays Normal type (but power still doubles). Weather Ball will receive STAB where appropriate - for example by Vanilluxe during a hailstorm, or Castform during sun, rain or hail since it transforms into the appropriate type. In sun and rain, the power of Weather Ball will gain an additional +50 power because Fire- and Water-type moves are boosted respectively in those conditions. (Other weather conditions don't receive any type boost.)
Flavor Text: This attack move varies in power and type depending on the weather.

Name: Whirlpool
Description: Whirlpool inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent in a vortex. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details. In addition, if the affected Pokémon is underwater because of Dive, this move's base power is doubled.
Flavor Text: The user traps the target in a violent swirling whirlpool for four to five turns.

Name: Whirlwind
Description: Whirlwind blows the target Pokémon away up to 20m, at the user's direction. Pokémon with the ability Suction Cups or those rooted by Ingrain are not affected by Whirlwind.
Flavor Text: The target is blown away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.

Name: Wicked Blow
Description: Always uses critical dice and ignores stat changes on the target

Name: Wide Guard
Description: Wide Guard protects nearby allies from all damage, until the beginning of the user's next turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves. The accuracy of Wide Guard does not decrease if used consecutively after itself or Quick Guard. However, it does decrease the accuracy of Protect, Detect, Endure, Spiky Shield, King's Shield and Baneful Bunker by one stage each time it or Quick Guard is used.
Flavor Text: The user and its allies are protected from wide-ranging attacks for one turn.
Meta: Reinterpreted so it's basically Protect but with an AOE range so it can protect nearby allies. Is it balanced to block multiple attacks?

Name: Wild Charge
Description: Wild Charge deals damage, but the user receives 25% of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.
Flavor Text: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes into its target. This also damages the user a little.

Name: Will-O-Wisp
Description: Will-O-Wisp causes the target to become burned, if it hits. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Flavor Text: The user shoots a sinister flame at the target to inflict a burn.

Name: Wing Attack
Description: Wing Attack deals damage with no additional effect.
Flavor Text: The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.

Name: Wish
Description: At the beginning of their next turn, the target recovers HP up to 50% of their max HP. The accuracy of Wish decreases by one stage after each time it is used. This decrease cannot be undone by effects which would normally restore accuracy.
Flavor Text: One turn after this move is used, the user’s or its replacement’s HP is restored by half the user’s max HP.
Meta: Changed to allow healing of nearby allies since healing moves are rare

Name: Withdraw
Description: Withdraw raises the user's Defense by one stage.
Flavor Text: The user withdraws its body into its hard shell, raising its Defense stat.

Name: Wonder Room
Description: Wonder Room switches the Defense and Special Defense stats of all Pokémon in battle, for the next 5 turns
Flavor Text: The user creates a bizarre area in which Pokémon’s Defense and Sp. Def stats are swapped for five turns.

Name: Wood Hammer
Description: Wood Hammer deals damage, but the user receives one-third of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
Flavor Text: The user slams its rugged body into the target to attack. This also damages the user quite a lot.

Name: Work Up
Description: Work Up raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.
Flavor Text: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk stats increase.

Name: Worry Seed
Description: Worry Seed changes the target's ability to Insomnia, which prevents the Pokémon from falling asleep. If the move is used on a sleeping Pokémon, it will wake up on its next turn. Worry Seed does not work on Pokémon with the ability Truant or Multitype.
Flavor Text: A seed that causes worry is planted on the target. It prevents sleep by making the target’s Ability Insomnia.

Name: Wrap
Description: Wrap inflicts damage immediately and then traps the opponent. See rules on "Trap Moves" for details.
Flavor Text: A long body, vines, or the like are used to wrap and squeeze the target for four to five turns.

Name: Wring Out
Description: Wring Out has a base power equal to the opponent's current HP, to a maximum of 110. Wring Out is a Special-category counterpart move to Crush Grip. It is also similar to Water Spout and Eruption, based on the opponent rather than the user.
Flavor Text: The user powerfully wrings the target. The more HP the target has, the greater the move’s power.

Name: X-Scissor
Description: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.
Flavor Text: The user slashes at the target by crossing its scythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.

Name: Yawn
Description: Yawn makes the target drowsy on the turn it is used. At the end of their next turn, they fall asleep. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move or act (with some exceptions such as Snore). Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
Flavor Text: The user lets loose a huge yawn that lulls the target into falling asleep on the next turn.

Name: Zap Cannon
Description: Zap Cannon deals damage and paralyzes the target (100% chance) if it hits. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.
Flavor Text: The user fires an electric blast like a cannon to inflict damage and cause paralysis.

Name: Zen Headbutt
Description: Zen Headbutt deals damage and has a 20% chance (a d20 rolls 17 or higher) of causing the target to flinch. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Flavor Text: The user focuses its willpower to its head and attacks the target. This may also make the target flinch.

Name: Zing Zap
Description: 30% chance (a d20 rolls 15 or higher) to cause flinching.
Flavor Text: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target, giving it an electric shock. This may also make the target flinch.
